Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: jlb27
Reviews.Content: Was on business trip for a week in Paris but did not need a fancy hotel to stay in. I chose that hotel because of the reviews I read and I was not disappointed. Staff are very nice and helpful, it is a very good location to stay in Paris (near Opera, Pigalle, Montmartre). The metro is 2mins walk (Metro st Georges), the location seems to be safe enough and the best for me is also to have Carrefour City just down the road :-)) The disappointment is the single room is very very tiny!! But bathroom and toilettry were good enough and clean - the shower is fantastic with lots of pressure but I think, instead of have a shower curtain, it is better to have put a shower door, so that you do not feel claustrophobic and the water will not run all over the floor. I also enjoyed the fact that for the same breakfast price (€13) you can have it brought up in the room, which saved me some time in the morning. I will probably stay there again if I come with my partner or friend in the superior room, but unfortunately I will skip it if I come back alone..

Reviews.Title: “Great value. Safe location.”
Reviews.Author: HojasRojas
Reviews.Content: Went to Paris for the first time and started my stay at Hotel France Albion. Easy to get to it from the Airport via Air France shuttle and then metro. There are 2 stops very near by. I was travelling alone for a few days and felt very safe here. The single room was cozy, comfy and clean. Great value. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in the Superior Double”
Reviews.Author: EzzOM
Reviews.Content: Booked the superior double which was very comfortable. Newly renovated, large bathroom and quiet (overlooks the courtyard at the back rather than the street). Rate included breakfast which was a standard French small buffet. Wifi was good and room was clean. Location is great, very close to 2 train lines, walk to Mont Martre and a longer walk to the Opera area with Gelleries lafayette. They looked after our bags before and after check-in/check-out. There are some supermarkets near the hotel as well as lots of restaurants. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again because of the good location and relatively good value for Paris. I would choose the superior double rooms as the others look a bit tired.

Reviews.Title: “Good, practical hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isabel R
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed here 4-8th Feb 2012. The room, even though very small, was warm and comfortable. Bathroom had powerful shower and was clean. As long as you don't pay too much attention to details you are fine in this hotel. There are 2 different underground lines (cadet and lorette de notre dame) less than 5 min walk. Plenty of restaurants and supermarkets around - there is a carrefour city across the road. You can also walk to Moulin Rouge, Sacre Coeur and to Gare du Nord (connection for airport link). The one thing that annoyed me was the smell of food in the bedroom first thing in the morning... not enough ventilation in kitchen downstairs?? So: perfect location, clean enough, quiet enough. NOT a romantic hotel, this is a good practical place to stay for a short break in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: SimonG1976
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, only around ten minutes from the Eurostar terminal. The rooms were clean and tidy and the breakfasts good. The staff were bilingual and extremely helpful. A pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, more like 3 star!”
Reviews.Author: Aoife_ireland100
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a three night stay in Paris. We didnt spend too much time here as there is so much to do and see in Paris. The breakfast was great and was down to E9 when we were there. I was quite scepticle about going to a 2 star in Paris when you hear how small the rooms can be but the room was big enough for our needs. The bed was comfortable, you could control your own heat and there was a great shower and bath with plenty of hot water. Can be bit noisy if overlooking street which we were so bring earplugs. Staff in reception were more than helpful and always pleasant, would definetly stay here again. Deserves 3 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great value”
Reviews.Author: Nanci B
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. Breakfasts included large assortment of goods, all well prepared, with fresh breads. Lobby area includes a small bar and garden area. Rooms were small but not as small as others in in Paris. Very clean throughout the hotel. They were in the process of updating the carpet during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kinsey W
Reviews.Content: The staff has been really helpful. They've given me directions and advice for the city and are always happy to answer any question. They're always staffed 24/7, so even when I went out late I didn't worry about getting back to my room. OK location, close to Pigalle and only next to one metro line (M2) but it's not bad to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Great value in Paris”
Reviews.Author: marrc24
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights over NYE. Considering the time of year we got a good value for the money. The package we booked included breakfast which otherwise is a little pricey. That being said, the breakfast was great - much bigger than anticipated. It included eggs, ham, fresh baked goods, fruit, cereals, cheese, etc. The room was a little small, but not too bad for Paris. It was clean and comfortable. Only minor issue is that the carpet and bedspread were stained and a little worn. The hotel has free wi-fi. Location is good - close to East and North train stations and two metro lines. You can easily walk to Opera Garnier in about 10 minutes. We found it a little tricky to get our bearings coming up from the metro stops near the hotel as there are many intersections with diagonal street crossings so make sure you are headed in the right direction. All in all I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel France Albion is simply amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ParisianInTraining
Reviews.Content: As a solo Female traveller and having never been to Paris before, I was determined to find a hotel that was clean, comfortable and safe. After reading hundreds of Trip Advisor reviews, I chose Hotel France Albion for my three nights in Paris (stayed December 2011) â€“ I was not disappointed! Hotel France Albion completely exceeded my expectations. My stay was a complete dream from the moment I confirmed by booking (they replied immediately in English by email) to the moment I (regrettably) boarded my shuttle to CDG. The staff put up with my dreadful attempts at French, spoke English fluently and were very friendly. They were also very helpful with everything from assisting with directions, organising my CDG shuttle and holding my luggage (both when I arrived early on my first day and when I checked out before going to the airport) to sourcing a corkscrew for me! I booked well in advance and got an amazing rate on a superior double room (Room 50) â€“ it was stunning and impeccably clean (Iâ€™m a bit of a clean freak and hard to impress, but I was certainly impressed). The room was serviced every day and the bed was exceptionally comfortable. The bathroom was huge (bigger than my bathroom at home!) and the water pressure and temperature were perfect. I was also impressed with the toiletries and coffee / tea making facilities that were complimentary in my room. There was also free wi-fi, which was very handy. I thought the hotel was in a perfect location. I felt very safe walking around the area by myself at night and the Notre Dame de Lorette metro was literally a one minute walk away (I also felt very safe on the metro by myself at night). There are also heaps of amazing boulangeries, patisseries and grocers opposite the hotel and in the surrounding streets. I didnâ€™t eat the breakfast at the hotel (I preferred to grab a coffee and croissant to eat while I walked), but it smelled amazing! I am so thankful that I chose to stay at Hotel France Albion it definitely made my stay in Paris unforgettable. I would have absolutely no hesitation in highly recommending it to my friends and family (and have already done so). I will definitely be staying here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: cherrytree80
Reviews.Content: This hotel provided a good location at a reasonable cost. It is located within walking distance of the Gare du Nord train station (the terminus of the Eurostar train) and close to two Metro lines (7 & 12). The neighborhood seems to be nice, however, there does not seem to be many restaurants nearby. However, there is a street one block over that has a number of markets, plus there is a Carrefour food store across the street. The rooms were basic and fairly small, but this is typical for Paris. When you are in Paris, you shouldn't be spending much time in your room. Some other reviews have commented that the 13 euro charge for breakfast is expensive and I guess the hotel has read the reviews, because when we were there, they dropped the rate to 9 euros. I think that is reasonable for what you are getting and you need to remember that you are in downtown Paris. For a price comparison, we went to the cafe across the street from the hotel for breakfast and for 9 euros all you got was juice, coffee, a coissant, and two eggs. There was much more selection at the hotel breakfast than this and it is a buffet. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a budget hotel in Paris that is clean, comfortable and conveniently located.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: rushanaprincess
Reviews.Content: i was in end of november Mama-daughter trip to paris and I choosen for this hotel,it maybe not a super hotel,but was nice,clean,personal was very attentive and nice.Hotel location is perfect for walkers,you can walk about 15 min to Louvre,and many other places.I would like to write about how to get this hotel:first you go to torist info,get(very imortant)museum pass(children up to 18 for free)take 10 tickets for metro,then get to train wich bring you to Gare du Nord station from there you take metro to Pigall station change line to green 12 direction Marie d'Issy go to station either St George or Notre-Dame de lorette,because hotel is between this 2 station.just bit difficult to choose direction after you go out of underground but just follow directiontowards rue Louvre:)Why it's important to get all tickets and museum pass in airport?because you not need to look for tourist info in city and you can start visit museums without waiting for lins(pretty long)and better to go to museums to 9.00les people to security control,especially to Notre Dame de Paris! We visited Le Cabaret,was great experience in theatre Le Marigny.Special place for me was museum D Orsay-very very reccomended,impressionist is great pictures.We not used train so mach ,because hotel is in perfect location,very safe area,in weekend it's a markets with fresh food,in Monmartre(not far away from hotel is in Thirsday and Sunday market for morning,very reccomended if you want to see or buy,i would come back there!

Reviews.Title: “It's really good hotel for stay in Paris, close to the subway and near to the main interesting place.”
Reviews.Author: Hasyim
Reviews.Content: The room it's clean, warm during winter, means the heater work properly. Tips for traveler to Paris, if you plan to use train from airport to hotel, do not bring the luggage, subway in Paris is not traveller friendly if you bring luggage. Best is use back pack then it will easy for you to move from one line to another line. Since not all provide elevator or escalator on the subway. For Hotel I recomend this hotel double tomb up.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable at affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: ronrush
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room (room 31) and it is by the street. The room is just the right size for 2 of us - nothing fancy, but comfortable and clean. What we really liked is the location of the hotel. 2mins walk and you will hit the Metro "Notre-Dame-de-Lorette" which is Line 12. This line goes to Saint Lazare (just 3 stops) you can get out and shop at Blvd Haussman (Printemps and Galerie Lafayette) or if you would like to go to rue Saint Honore you can drop at Concorde (where all the rest of the major sites are). Actually when we were there it was raining quite a lot but it was still walkable to many places. Galerie Lafayette is just 15mins walk. Book early for the best rates! The breakfast (all you can eat) costs 13 euros per pax, which we tried for one day. Personally I felt that it was a bit expensive, but well, you definitely can eat all you can so it is still worth it if you want to feed yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Charming Location”
Reviews.Author: LVJ1980
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel France Albion and had a comfortable stay. The desk staff really stand out. They are incredibly friendly and eager to help. I arrived at the hotel aroumd 11am and check-in wasn't supposed to be until 2pm, however the young woman at the desk called the housekeeper to prepare my room and within 30 minutes, I was settling in. After a long overnight flight, I appreciated that I didn't have to wait. I stayed on the first floor in a single. It was small with a twin bed, but it's a single so what can you expect? (I also sleep in a twin bed at home, so I can't complain about that lol). The bathroom was quite spacious. Everything was clean and there was soap, a shower cap, shoe shine and bath gel/shampoo in the bathroom. The room had a television (that I never watched), small desk, nightstand, telephone and a safe in the closet. The safe didn't work for me and I mentioned it but they probably forgot. No big deal. The hotel has great wifi and an elevator. The location is great. I was worried about noise when I read that there was a bar next door but I heard nothing. In fact, the hotel was very quiet. The hotel is close to 3 metros: Notre Dame de Lorette and St. georges (line 12) and Le Peletier (line 7). I was able to get where I needed to go easily. The only negative regarding location is getting there from the airport. I had the choice of taking the RER B to Gare du Nord then taking Bus 43 or taking the RoissyBus to Opera and taking a cab. I chose the latter. It's just that I was on a tight budget this trip so every euro mattered. It would have been nice to just be able to easily go from the RER to the metro to the hotel. Since I had an early flight, the hotel arranged a shuttle for me back to CDG. It cost 26 euros but the convenience was worth the expense. Right across from the hotel is a Carrefour grocery store and if you continue out to the other side of the Carrefour there's a farmer's market, bounlanger, butcher, etc. The area was quite safe and on Sunday, it was cool to see the Parisians out and about, buying their bread, doing their shopping, just strolling in the streets. :) I would definitely recommend this hotel! The price is perfect. The location is good. The staff is super nice (Fahrad was great). For a 2 star hotel, it really deserves it's high rank on tripadvisor.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money, clean rooms, friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: CH-tourist-G
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the tripadvisor reviews and I was not disappointed. I have stayed at a few hotels in this price range before, but the France Albion is the by far the best. I stayed in the double with twin beds, but my group had also booked the "superior" double. Here is why the hotel is a great pick: - Rooms are rather spacious by comparison to rooms at other hotels in this price range - Particularly the bathrooms are large and pretty new, with a bath tub and good amenities (incl. hair dryer, shower gels, etc) - The rooms, bathroom, sheets, towels are very clean - Considering the street noise the rooms are very quiet, the windows are well-insulated, neighbors were having a party on one night, but when I shut the windows I slept beautifully - At least during my stay the room was cleaned every day after I left (even when I left at noon) - The superior room didn't seem larger, but it appeared more recently renovated, was more stylish and had a coffee maker/ water boiler (both rooms had a flat screen TV) - The staff at the reception is extremely friendly (the reception is open 24/7, I arrived to check in at 11:30pm and it wasn't a problem, in fact the guy at the reception was very friendly) - The breakfast was simple, but plentiful and tasty - There are plenty of cafes/bars in the surrounding area, after the first day we just ate breakfast at the cafe up the street - The subway line is walking distance and takes you straight to Pont Neuf. You can also walk to Sacre Coeur (maybe 20min), the Opera (ca. 15min - the Roissybus straight from CDG airport also stops here), Galleries Lafayette (ca. 10min). All in all, if you're looking for some place simple, clean and hasslefree in the heart of Paris for a short city trip, it's a great pick. I for myself will gladly return.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: maxandcoMonza
Reviews.Content: I booked on the web for a one night stay in a business trip. The rate was 83 eur, good enough for Paris these days (most hotels full), and it was a very good deal. A short walk from many nice areas and, most important, from public transportation. The neighborough is full of restaurants of all kinds. Small room, but clean. Free wifi, better than the average (not too slow). Very nice people, both at arrival and checkout. haven't tried breakfast (13 euros: you get some very good stuff very close, for less).

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean, great value... perfect hotel in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: codyzu
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in October in a single room. Average size room by European standards (small by American standars). Included a bathroom and shower (not standard in Paris at this price). The staff was extremely friendly and the desk/front door is open 24 hours. Staff spoke perfect English on the phone and in person. Not much of a view from the windows, but no one comes to Paris to stay in the room. I didn't bother with the breakfast... save your money, tons of bakeries nearby and the Carrefour City (small supermarket) across the street. Located maybe 2 blocks from the metro line 12 and a 10 minute walk max to the metro line 7. Free wifi. The staff was super friendly. Call and tell them how you will be arriving in Paris and they will tell you exactly how to get the hotel (what metro lines and changes you will need to make). They even noticed that I was leaving the next day and offered to book me a shuttle to the airport the night before my departure (I arrived by train so I didn't need it, probably costs, but it was a very nice gesture). The room and bathroom was very clean. Only minor con would be the shower curtain was kind of long and ended up touching me a bit while showering. It was a cloth material and the bottom of it looked a bit stained/mildewy from the water. Minor detail, but it was a slight annoyance. Finally, I first checked the prices on the internet and then called. They quoted me a higher price on the phone. I told them about the price on the internet and the person replied they didn't see the promotion (that was the price on the internet) and that they could give me the same price. Booked using their website in the end. I usually avoid booking hotels using the website (I like to talk to a person to avoid any surprises or computer glitches), but it worked perfectly. I will stay here again next time I am in Paris. Great price for a great hotel in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jennie212
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights from 20 to 22 October 2011 at Family Room with ensuite, airconds and a refrigerator. Clean rooms and beddings are comfortable. Buffet breakfast at 13 euros. Carrefour supermarket is just directly opposite the hotel. Many eateries and a nice bakery near the hotel. Walking distance to Opera House, Galleries Lafayette and Printemps stores. Friendly staff and speak fairly good English. My opinion hotel should provide tea/coffee facilities in the room. Definitely recommend this 2-Star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay at a pleasant location”
Reviews.Author: Yozsta
Reviews.Content: Paris is just around the corner nowadays with the Thalys between Schiphol and Gare du Nord, so a short trip to watch a rugby game with my son is one of the pleasures of life I love to indulge myself in. We picked France Albion as our place to stay because of its location in the 9th arrondissement close to the train station (a 20 minute walk or two short metro rides) and easy access to the rest of Paris. Although the interior dates from the previous century, it wasn't worn down. The room was clean and nicely located at the front of the hotel with a view of the always charming rooftops. The staff at reception and breakfast were friendly and service oriented, which makes a stay always so much better. So, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel for our last leg of our tour”
Reviews.Author: iLurve248
Reviews.Content: checked in this lovely hotel after a 2-week trip starting from dijon and headed north towards paris. stayed at several 2-star international chain hotels during the trip and i must say that hotel france albion offered more than my partner and i had expected. room and bathroom were big (by france's standards). didnt mind not having english channels cos we're in paris. who stays in the hotel to watch the telly anyway? walking distance to the shopping streets, cafes, market and easy bus rides to tourist sights for those who are tired of walking. most importantly, the day and night receptionists were very friendly and offered good tips. we were much happier catching the buses, instead of the metro, and taking in the sights. brekkie was costly but since there are heaps of bakeries nearby, it didnt bother us. was woken up every morning by inconsiderate neighbours who opened/closed doors loudly since the doors were less than a metre or 2 from mine.

Reviews.Title: “cute little hotel”
Reviews.Author: penn1975
Reviews.Content: i stayed here just for one night by myself. i had a single room on the 5th floor. it was a small single room with a single bed, tv, a bathroom with shower and view over back of building. room clean, a bit dated. but had free air con. and bathroom had a good shower with complimentry toiletries. tv had no english speaking channels but that didnt bother me. even though my room was next to the lift it was very quiet and could hear no outside noise through night and i slept well. room was lacking tea coffee facilites which would been really handy, and breakfast was not included in my rate, i could of purchased there but at 13 euros i thought a little dear. as lots cafes near by. location is reasonable only 5 or so minutes from rue de layfette. and metro stops near by too. reception were polite friendly and offered maps and sure would of been helpful had i needed to ask anything. all in all not a bad place to stay for price. in a decent area that felt safe to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly little place”
Reviews.Author: Maximusgattimus
Reviews.Content: Small hotel where the staff was friendly and welcoming. good English skills and very proactive to encourage you to discover the district and Paris.

Reviews.Title: “would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: JGL37
Reviews.Content: My daughter (19) and I spent two nights at the Hotel France Albion in mid-October and we would gladly stay there again. Staff is friendly, made arrangements for the shuttle from/to the airport, private bathrooms with a shower and a bath! You would consider the rooms small if you are north american but they are quite functional and included a TV! A 10 minute walk and you are at the Place de l'Opera or the Galeries Lafayettes or 15 minutes in the other direction you are at SacrÃ© Coeur! Easy bus ride to the Eifel Tower as well. We didn't have their breakfast since we thought 13 euros was too much so we just walked down the road to the local bakery. Definately good value for money - we got an internet special at 87 euros/night for a double.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: margaritaville
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of September 2011.Reception was friendly and welcoming.Rooms were typically small ish for Paris.They were clean and tidy however, as was the bathroom.Beds were comfy and allowed a good night's sleep despite some early morning street noise, again not unusual for big European city centre locations. Two metro stops a short walk away, several bars and restaurants likewise.The only negative was the fact that the restaurant that we'd asked the hotel to book for us nearby was closed when we arrived for our meal!Not the Albion's fault of course, though they apologised when we told them about the episode.I have mentioned the incident in our "review" of the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel in a fantastic location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SilviaandChris
Reviews.Content: Although it is a two star hotel, it was a fantastic hotel in a great location in Paris. Very clean, good size rooms, fantastic value for money and very nice and helpful staff. I can only recommend it to anyone, from families to couples, friends, anyone. You couldn't hear a sound in the room we had! The only thing that the room was missing was a minibar or fridge, as it was very hot in paris even in november. The aircon was great though and the staff at reception gave us some ice for our drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Paz I
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel seems old fashioned at first look, the rooms are quite nice and large for paris and at a great location in paris! The only bad thing was the breakfest. My advice if your traveling to paris on a budget - stay at this hotel while not taking the breakfest.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel at a very good location”
Reviews.Author: mariosN
Reviews.Content: I rented 2 rooms in this hotel for my family. One room had a refrigerator that we found very useful . Just opposite there is a Carrefour supermarket so we got everything we needed. The rooms were very clean, the receptionists very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located 2 minutes walk from St Georges Metro and also 10 minutes walk from Lafayette Stores. The price was also very good . Definitely recommended.

Reviews.Title: “mike newcastle”
Reviews.Author: michael i
Reviews.Content: very clean and comfortable hotel. Friendly staff who spoke great English. Good value for money and great location. You feel as though you are in the real Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming place in Paris”
Reviews.Author: saltearth
Reviews.Content: In a city known for its beauty and landmarks, but not for its welcoming demeanor, this little hotel helps to dispel that myth. While hearing of hotels with stratospheric rates and even neighboring hotels getting props from fellow travelers, we returned to the 9th arrondissement to this charming hotel. All the comforts one could wish for, a bar and computer (for a fee) in the lobby, helpful staff, free wifi, clean and comfortable rooms, and a modest price made for a tremendous value. If only the breakfast wasn't so pricey, this would be a perfect stay. That being said, with a supermarket across the street, and a great market street on the other side of it, as well as another (Rue Cadet) down the hill, a pop into the bar across the street for a cafe, and you can "fill up" Parisian style and save your money to spend at any of the neighboring restaurants. I have found it difficult to return to hotels as we discover them as they book up quickly, hopefully this one will be available upon our return.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ruben-Anthony
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are medium sized by US standards and large by european standards. I loved this hotel. Staff was friendly, rooms were clean. Location was not center of paris, but in a great neighborhood right near a metro stop. We really enjoyed it. Also the grocery store right across the street was awesome. The OJ they sold is my favorite. I crave it all the time. Oh and up the street is a pizza joint that had great pizza and stayed open late. I know, I know. Who buys pizza in Paris. Well it was late, I was hungry. It was close and it was open.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jouanna b
Reviews.Content: I am a solo traveller and visit Paris once a year, usually not staying in the same hotel twice, but with this hotel i;ll definitley be back! If you are looking for a budget hotel, ideally situated in the heart of Paris, clean, freshly painted, friendly staff, friendly neighborhood, metro & supermarket across the street, well this is the hotel you should stay at:) by the way don't miss out on breakfast, it is really good. Not to forget a big thanks goes to the friendly staff who were super helpful. I would recommend taking the shuttle bus from/to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Yes it was "Simply Perfect"”
Reviews.Author: bumpy2
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: I'm the other half of the trip with Poortravler (see his post), but I wanted to add my own thoughts about this wonderful little hotel. Poortravler really did his homework, researching nearly 300 hotels one at a time, and he sure picked a winner. Yes, the rooms in this charming old building are small by American standards, but large enough by any European measure. How much room do you need anyway? You're there to enjoy Paris, non? The two most important amenities: (i) central air conditioning, and (ii) a private bathroom with tub and showerhead, lots of fresh towels and washcloths, and hot, high-pressure water. The AC is preset by the hotel and can't be adjusted, but it is chilly enough to cool the room instantly and let you sleep well all night. It also means you can close the very efficient windows against the noise of the ubiquitous Parisian motorbikes. Don't even think of booking a room without air conditioning in August. As the other reviews have noted, the rooms are clean, the beds are comfortable, and the service is wonderful. We requested and received a refrigerator that we used for cold fruit and drinks. The WiFi is also free, so don't hesitate to take your computer. It will help you plan or change your itinerary once you arrive. The hotel's location in the 9th arrondissement near the Opera Garnier makes it accessible to everything in central Paris, and it's only half a block from a Metro station. The hotel's best value, though, is in its staff. We booked our accomodations through Aurelie, who speaks perfect English and is on the day desk. She was so kind and gracious to us throughout our stay, as were all the hotel employees. She gave us valuable tourist information and also made SURE that we booked the best return to Charles de Gaulle Airport. As it turned out, our return to the airport in a terrible thunderstorm would have been a disaster without her recommendation. If you take our advice and book with this little boutique hotel, you won't be sorry. And give our best to Aurelie!

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bear73
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel France Albion for a night in Sept 2011. The hotel is located in the triangle between Gare du Nord (20 min walk), Montmartre (15 min walk to Moulin Rouge/Pigalle) and the Opera/Grand Boulevards district. I had a single room on the 5th floor which was pleasant and clean. The room itself was on the small side, but not unusual for Paris. As it was rather warm when we were there, the air-conditioning was a welcome relief after spending all day walking around. The only slight complaint that I have was that the room wasn't very well sound proofed, and the other people on the same floor as me were clearly much earlier risers than me, and were slamming doors and stomping around by about 6am which wasn't great. The breakfast (which was an additional â‚¬13) wasn't included in my room, but to be perfectly honest, there are a number of patisseries and cafes within 5 mins walk, where you can get a pastry and a coffee for around â‚¬3. The metro station (St George - line 12) was about 200m away from the hotel. All in all, it's a good little hotel, if a little over priced, but that's Paris for you

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: poortrvler
Reviews.Content: Over the last few years, I've become the appointed tour guide for family vacations. Of course, this has included finding domestic and international accommodations. In all our travels, we've learned one important lesson: room and board and can either make or break your vacation--even if you use it for nothing but a crash site after touring all day/night. That is why I spend a great deal of time researching hotels/B&Bs/apartments before making a decision--typically several hundred 1-3 star hotels. Generally, I've found that hotels that can offer everything are few and far between. They may offer a prime location, a multitude of amenities, extraordinary service, palatial rooms, and feather beds, but you're going to pay out the nose for it. Like you, I'd prefer to have some or all of those things for a great price. But every once in a while a place comes along that really CAN offer it all. Such is the case for the France Albion Hotel. If I were to ever visit Paris again, I wouldn't even consider staying anywhere else. For 85euros, we were 5-10 minutes from the Paris Opera House (1 mile from the Louvre), had AC, a safe, fridge, free Wifi, cable TV, private bathroom, phone, breakfast (good price), and a large/quiet/clean room. Most importantly, Aurelie showed us the friendliest hotel service we've ever come across. She was able to offer suggestions and insight into Paris that really made our trip unforgettable. When you consider all the factors that go into making a decision on an accommodation, there's a good reason why this hotel ranks so high on Trip Advisor: it's a 2 star hotel with 4 star service. Save yourself some time, and give Aurelie a call. It'll be the best decision you ever made.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Karebear85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived early in the morning to Paris on an overnight train. The staff was wonderful and although our room was not ready they allowed us to get changed in a clean bathroom near the lobby and store our bags in a room close by. We headed out for the day to explore Paris and when we returned our room was ready. There was a spacious elevator - we found in most of Europe if there was an elevator it was unlikely that 2 people and luggage would fit - but this time we all fit in! Wonderful. The room was clean and wonderful. The bathroom had lots of space and the shower was amazing. There was no fridge but the staff was helpful and got us lots of ice to keep drinks cold - my sister had sent us a bottle of champagne as a surprise and they brought it on a tray with ice and glasses. The staff helped us with directions and questions about the bus, tours to Versailles, and a shuttle to the airport. There was a fire alarm that went off because someone was smoking close to the alarm while we were there and they apologized to us for the inconveniance which is just another example of how great they were. I absolutely loved Paris and would return and stay at this hotel again. It was in a great spot, close to easy transportation and lots of restaurants. It was the perfect end to our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for money in Paris”
Reviews.Author: GwenNiles
Reviews.Content: Reception-staff are very helpful and speak very good English. Location is near busy streets but very quiet. Close to two subway-stations. Room is good size for Paris, bathroom is very big for Paris. We booked a superior room, which only costs â‚¬2, 00 per night more if you book via internet. Room is clean and well maintained, fresh towels every day, coffee maker and airconditioning in the room. Canal+ channels available. Safe with your own private code in the closet. Shower and toilet function very well. Breakfast very nice: fried and boiled eggs, fried potatoes, baked ham, different kind of meats, cheese and your sweets. .. coffee is great too. And remember, it's a two star hotel. .. .

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Prenexus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Albion for 2 nights in August. The rooms were small but very comfortable - I think it was the superior room. Very helpful and friendly staff. Wifi was provided by the hotel and it was fast enough for Skype. Location was excellent - only a few minutes walk to the nearest Metro and probably 20 minutes from Gare du Nord on foot. We easily walked to Opera, le Louvre and many of the other attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: trip496
Reviews.Content: Great location,cozy hotel in a lovely Paris neighbourhood.Clean but very small rooms,not very comfy with noisy guests next door.Helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean hotel with excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Riikkamy
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with this hotel and would definitely come back. Our room and bathroom were very clean and decoration comfortable. Location is good, there is many restaurants, shops and bars in neighbourhood. Only breakfast wasn't worth its price, but we ate something from the nearby bakery.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in cute Paris neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: PantherChic
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was in our budget and most others were booked by the time we knew of our trip. The front desk clerk during the day was very helpful and polite. We arrived at noon so they held our luggage in a little courtyard room for us. When we came back late that night, the night clerk was a little gruff but still helpful. Our room was at the top of the stairs. Typical tiny elevator and narrow winding stairs. Room was small but perfectly adequate for what we were there for - sleeping. Nice bed, tv, coffee maker(didn't use it). The shower was wonderful - great hot water and wonderful water pressure (better than home!). Walls are thin so its very easy to hear when your neighbors come home, but we were usually so tired from sightseeing that we slept just fine. Breakfast is in a quaint stone basement - very nice. Typical continental breakfast. The best part of this hotel was how close it was to the metro - just about a block or so walk, easy to get to. Lovely neighborhood feel to the area - would have liked to spend more time walking around there but we didn't have time. Overall I think we'd stay here again if we went back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and room.”
Reviews.Author: minn26
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our double room was upgraded. We were early but the lady on reception took us to an area to drop off our bags, showed us where the toilets were and asked if we needed a map. The room was spotlessly clean, very quiet and had everything we needed. Staff were helpful and friendly throughout our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Harriet_TA
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel in Paris. It is rated 2 star, but in my book it's worth 5. The room we had (a double) was small, but more than adequate and the large bathroom made up for any lack of space elsewhere. Nice decor and good bed. AC. We bought the rate including breakfast which was quite good. The people who work at the Albion are terrific. It's on a quiet street with restaurants and services within walking distance. There are 2 Metro stops within 1 block which made it easy to get around the city. Not to far from Gare Nord (train station).Walk up the hill 2 blocks, turn right at the Pharmacy, and you will find 5 restaurants; 2 ethnic and 2 cafes and one fancier. They are open on Sundays (a big plus in that city!). W

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: TheBanster
Reviews.Content: Quite simply the best value for money hotel I know in Paris...friendly staff, on a quiet street yet only yards from the important line 12 metro, small but functional warm rooms. What more do you want for this price?

Reviews.Title: “Charming and affordable, with welcome extra touches”
Reviews.Author: KJA3
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights in a single room at the Hotel France Albion in mid-May. This small hotel is very near metro stops on 2 different lines and is within easy walking distance of the Palais Garnier. It did not feel like a highly touristed neighborhood, and the neighborhood felt safe at all times of day (which is important to me, as a solo female travelerâ€”even fairly late at night, there were people walking their dogs or walking from the metro). And there was a supermarket across the street that sold food, wine, basic supplies, etc. during regular business hours. I wouldnâ€™t call this hotelâ€™s location great, but I would definitely call it very good. My room was simply, charmingly, and cheerfully decorated; spotlessly clean; and accessible by elevator. As others have noted, the hotel makes good use of an unusual non-rectangular floor plan. My room looked out into a courtyard and was quiet. It was not a particularly spacious room, but it was larger than many hotel rooms in Paris and was well laid out. The bed was very comfortable and the water pressure and temperature were good. The optional breakfast buffet was more generous than many; for example, it including scrambled eggs in addition to a pleasing and reasonably extensive array of more commonly available items. (As with most hotel breakfat options in Paris, and elsewhwre in France, if all you want is coffee and a baguette or croissant, youâ€™ll probably pay less if you go elsewhere.) By French criteria for star designations, which reflect which services are offered (without regard to the quality of those services), this is a 2 star hotel. The services of a French 2 star are more than adequate for my needs. Even in this context, the staff, who all spoke English, were wonderful and provided a level of service a cut above--well above--what I had expected given the hotelâ€™s very affordable price range. For example, Martin worked with me extensively before my trip to try to obtain a ticket for an event I hoped to attend. (It turned out that the event was sold out even before tickets were offered to those who werenâ€™t season subscribers, but I truly appreciated his repeated efforts to check on their availability.) And before arriving in France, I had made multiple unsuccessful attempts to make dinner reservations at two restaurants outside Paris; a young woman at the hotelâ€™s desk kindly and efficiently arranged both reservations for me. Two other specific features of this hotel might be of particular interest to travelers from the U.S.: (1) The computer that guests can use for a small fee has a qwerty keyboard. I had no idea how hard it would be to find a qwerty keypboard in France or how hard I would find it to use a non-qwerty keyboard! BTW, I think Wifi access was free for those with their own computer. (2) The linens include a washcloth. â˜º I like to use a washcloth for exfoliation, but more importantly, I find a washcloth essential for minimizing the risk of losing a contact lens down a drain. If the location and the services offered by this hotel meet your needs in Paris, I recommend it enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “Delicious food and friendly staff â€“ Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Marioncami
Reviews.Content: Myself and my hubby stayed at this hotel for three days. Our stay was quite a pleasant one. The room was spacious enough, the bathroom too large and clean. We slept comfortably there. The food was great! Delicious meals to try every time. The food however was a bit costly. But no regrets, it was worth the price. This hotelâ€™s location also is good. There are restaurants, grocery stores, shopping areas, sightseeing and other places of entertainment around. The staff there were also friendly and helpful. We had an excellent stay here. We wouldnâ€™t mind staying at this place for one more time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient well location and reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: ALBERTCAN
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located close to Montmartre and metro stations St Georges and Notre Dame de Lorette. Also within walking distance to major shopping (Lafayette, Hausmann Blvd), sights (Madeleine, Concorde, Tuileries) and culture (Opera, Louvre, D'Orsay, Orangerie etc.). Quaint and fairly quiet neighborhood. Pleasant service at the front desk, clean and comfortable rooms (small size for N. Americans, but then, how much time do you spend there?). Breakfast in the cellar is pricy but good although we missed the baguettes.

Reviews.Title: “Very average - though Damian's assistance raised our view of the hotel above average!”
Reviews.Author: Kristine_Tim
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only 140m from laundrette in Rue du Faubourg Montmartre. The Metro Station Saint Georges is 160m from hotel and Metro Notre-Dame-de-Lorette is 90m from hotel. Great location for necessities. Quiet surroundings. Shower did not work properly and dirty linen, however when these were pointed out, were remedied promptly. Room was way too small (and this was the "superior double"!). Majority of staff were aloof, however Damian <3 was very friendly and incredibly helpful. The receipt for our booking stated that check in was from 10am, yet upon our arrival we were told it was in fact 2pm.

Reviews.Title: “Would come back”
Reviews.Author: Lesley_C_F
Reviews.Content: Brilliant little hotel. Basic but spotlessly clean, helpful staff, tasty breakfast. Nice to be away from the tourist hotspots at night. Village feel to the area with excellent cafes and restaurants, supermarket, fromagerie, boulangerie. Try Sizin, a Turkish restaurant in the next street. Brilliant. I would stay here again. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff, great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 186605Mac
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were recommended this hotel by a relative and we were not disappointed. The hotel location in Montmarte is great as a base for exploring Paris with easy access to the Metro and within easy walking distance of the beautiful Sacre-Couer basilica. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel itself has a welcoming atmosphere. The rooms are well presented and maintained but they are small - this is to be expected given its location I suppose. Overall we had a very enjoyable stay on our short city break and would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Good convenient and clean base for short Paris break”
Reviews.Author: yearningtogo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break with my adult son booked through Eurostar. As previous reviewers have stated the hotel is very clean and comfortable. We walked form Gare Du Nord - an easy slightly downhill 15 minute walk. Most of the main tourist sites and shops are within walking distance but the Metro is handy for when the feet are tired! We stayed on the top floor (room 61). No bath but good shower. We didn't partake of the breakfast to cut costs. Took a travel kettle (first timers beware - no kettles in rooms) and purchased fruit and croissants from Carrefour opposite the hotel. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay ...”
Reviews.Author: g_frisk
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, nice rooms and perfect location. Rooms were small but spotlessly clean and nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly good 2* hotel in central Paris”
Reviews.Author: jeff22London
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a birthday treat booked through Eurostar. We were agreably surprised to discover a good cooked breakfast was included. The personnel were friendly and helpful and the room was a reasonable size and with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was larger than expected with a good bath/shower. The area is interesting and well located for Metros and very near the Opera and Grand Magasins districts. There s a Michelin * restaurant around the corner. We would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Jo_28_87
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend in January with a friend. Chose the hotel after reading reviews on Trip Advisor and I wasn't disappointed. Our twin room was a good size for Paris and it was very clean and it had everything we needed. The bathroom was equally clean, bright and spacious and the shower was excellent. We could walk everywhere we needed to go, close to both Opera Garnier and Montmartre, but St.Georges Metro was also only a minute walk away. Carrefour supermarket literally opposite hotel, so really convenient. Only negative is that it would benefit from double glazing as traffic can be quite noisy. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: everythingcounts
Reviews.Content: I and my boyfriend went through Europe and Paris was our third stop. When we came to the hotel the staff helped out very much. Excellent speaking guy, that helped us with tips about restaurants, nightlife etc. It was close to the subway and a very nice neighborhood. In the morning you could just go around the corner and buy yourself a new baked croissant. They also had a bigger grocery store close by, as well as restaurants. The rooms were not that big, but they were fresh. TV, a desk and a smaller wardrobe (with safety) was also in the room. Nice bathroom with a bathtub. We were very pleased with our stay, and if we go back to Paris we would stay at this hotel again. You get a lot for your money. And thatâ€™s good, because in Paris, everythingâ€™s expensive :)

Reviews.Title: “That good we returned and will again.”
Reviews.Author: TravellerUK160
Reviews.Content: Reviewed this hotel when we stayed there while in Paris to see the Tour De France. We had no hesitation in booking it again when we had a few days in Paris to see Supertramp. Friendly,helpful and English speaking staff. Close to the Metro and some of the main attractions. Happy to return and will do again. It would be nice if it had free internet but there are several cafes nearby that have to get by with.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, good location. Small room and no breakfast for the price paid..”
Reviews.Author: ffqueiroz
Reviews.Content: Room was ok, really small , but clean.. Quality of sleep very good, no noise on hotel or in the neighborhood. Price a little expensive in my opinion, from what it offers. Guest service nice .

Reviews.Title: “Absolutey wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Happywanderer0655
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful find this hotel was at the end of a long and sometimes arduous trip through Morocco ending in Paris. An easy metro ride and walk to the hotel although airport pick-up is offered. Lovely location, excellent price for the quality offered. Staff (we met four different people) were unfailingly polite and very helpful in English, (my French is very limited). They gave us good recommendations for food, sites etc. I can't say enough good things about this place. I will definitely go back to Paris and will hope to stay here. Thanks for the super time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: PghGirl26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in October and were very happy with our choice. The staff was great, especially Dominic at the front desk. He arranged for a private car for us and got us a great driver at a great price during the transportation strikes. Our room was a bit small but with a little time we spent there it was just fine. My only complaint is no free internet access, but all in all that is minor. The location is great and very close to the metro.

Reviews.Title: “A good price for Paris!”
Reviews.Author: julieanne80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in October 2010. Considering the price, my expectations weren't too high but I was hopeful. I was NOT disappointed! It may seem to be a bit far from the center of Paris with the Arc de Triomphe, Louvre, etc, but it's very close to 2 Metro stations, and when you're in Paris, if you're close to the Metro, you're close to everything! It has everything you need right across the street, with a small grocery store that sells anything you could possibly need or want and stays open until 11pm as well as a laundrymat just down the street that's open until 10pm. There are plenty of restaurants/cares around too. The room and bathroom were super clean and cleaned daily with fresh towels. There's an elevator that's hardly ever busy since the hotel's not that big. The people at hte front desk were helpful and friendly. You can access the hotel 24hrs/day, there's no lockdown time. The only thing that I found disappointing was the Wi-Fi access was not free. It was 6 euro/day, so we only bought it for one day in the middle of the trip to keep family posted on our whereabouts. Otherwise, I would totally recommend it. We were close enough to walk home from Moulin Rouge, which was awesome since the Metro was no longer running at that time and the odds of getting a cab in front of the theatre at the end of a show is nearly impossible. Also close to trendy Montmartre neighborhood, which is a great place to check out. For the price, considering it's Paris, I would totally recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoveCobra
Reviews.Content: This is not a bad Budget Hotel in a reasonable location. Half an hour to Lourve by foot, 30 minutes to Sacre Coeur by foot. Staff were friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean but very small. Before you say that it is Europe we have been travelling for 5 weeks and this was by far the smallest room. The room was serviced each day, so kept clean. Didn't eat breakfast there so can't comment. Hotel was quiet. As said not a bad hotel, think could find better for same money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Mostafa1020
Reviews.Content: English speaking staff is of high importance in Paris which everybody prefer to speak French, even if they know English! There are very nice staff at France Albion Hotel, Mr. Damiar to name a few. He was very kind to me. Beside the staff, hotel was clean and close to shopping centers and some must-to-see places. To describe it in a nutshell, I have to say that I enjoyed staying there and will choose there next time visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: heatherandbob
Reviews.Content: Really good location, very friendly staff. Thankfully for us, all staff understood English and were extremely helpful. Would not hesitate to book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely friendly hotel off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: PiaffeMoorooduc
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel 5 years ago and thought it was pretty good then. If anything, this stay was better. The Hotel France Albion is located in the 9th Arrondissement so it's not wildly fashionable (thank goodness!). But it is a very good, very unpretentious hotel that offers a great location between a couple of metro lines (St Georges, Notre Dame de Lorette, etc) so you can get around Paris easily. There is a supermarket across the street and good restaurants within a 5 minute walk - we tried 3 of them and had 3 terrific meals. The hotel staff are fantastic - very helpful and friendly. I was with 2 other girlfriends who had not stayed there and they were also delighed with their rooms....especially the climate control as we were there in a Paris heatwave. I will definitely be going back to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “hotel provides good value for money with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: jbuffet_10
Reviews.Content: well located with two metro stationsat either end of street. moulin rouge within easy walking distance.breakfast was adequate -just what you'd expect with fruit /fresh bread and cooked bacon,ham,eggs-good selection to cover all tastes.room small which is quite common in paris.only downside was no mirror in the bedroom but adequate mirror/lighting in bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay there again”
Reviews.Author: jdsilva
Reviews.Content: Just as all the reviews suggested, a great hotel for the price and very friendly reception staff that spoke English so it not too stressful landing there that you needed to be fluent in French. The room was standard, just noisy as it was facing the street. But what more do you need a clean and comfortable bed, a clean washroom, yes a shower curtain would have helped. But all in all we would definitely visit again. We took a Metro pass and found using the metro very easy and enjoyable after a few starting glitches but being close to the Metro and getting advice from reception was great. The area was very safe too - the first night we walked back from Moulin Rouge at 2 am...didnt feel threatened or unsafe at all. The shuttle was a big help too.

Reviews.Title: “Overall not that impressed”
Reviews.Author: ljn26
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews I went with quite high expectations...although being a 2* I was aware of the hotels limitations. First impressions were good, very helpful English speaking gentleman, lift access and small but clean room. In honesty I found more negatives then positives and would not return from a very rude night receptionist, to a bug on my pillow and an air conditioning unit that sounded like it was having a bath! The bathroom was also very tired and needed updating and had titles missing as well as no shower curtain. The location of the hotel was great and the nearest station is St Georges, although we walked to most places. Be aware that in order to walk to Montmartre it is all up hill. The best find of staying in the 9th district was Le Petit Carnard - a fantastic duck restaurant a 5 min walk away.....simply a must. Although the hotel did not detract from my visit, as I spent most of my time exploring the city, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming hotel - We've already booked to return here this year!”
Reviews.Author: abroad123
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on a fairly useless metro line, the number 4. You have to change to get anywhere, but the changes are easy enough. However, it is a quick 15-minute walk from Gare du Nord, and from Sacre Couer. Its breakfast may be called a mite overpriced, but they provide eggs and other goodies that you don't get from your typical Parisian breakfast. Fill up for your 13 euros, or go across the street to the cafe. The staff are welcoming and fluent in English, they have a little bar where you can get a beer and sit, the rooms are clean, quiet and well-lit, and the bedding is comfortable. You sleep well. We have stayed at hotels all over Paris, and this one we will return to. In fact, we've already booked another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: Patriiao47
Reviews.Content: We were very glad to be there. The people at the front desk, especially Martin and AurÃ©lie, were very kind and helpful. Breakfast is not included, itÂ´s very good but it should have fresh fruit instead of tinned fruit salad. Fruit is great in France! They reduced price from 13 euros to 9 euros on our last day.I think 9 was a good choice.. I definitely recommend this hotel and we would go back, of course.

Reviews.Title: “Merci beaucoup”
Reviews.Author: skyblue16
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, had a great experience, I agree with a previous review that it does feel 'homely' the neighbourhood is typically french, traditional. Great location, George metro stop a minutes walk, Pigalle/Monmartre within easy walking distance as is La fayette in the opposite direction. The size of our room was fine, facing the street, ok you do get traffic noise but lovely just to open the french windows after a days sightseeing and rest a while. For the money we paid it was great value, breakfast was more than adequate, continental, ok so it won't win any awards but certainly enough to get your day going. From the moment we checked in, we were made to feel most welcome, our french is limited but I felt at ease to try a little, you get the feeling you can try as much or as little as you prefer, english is spoken very well by the reception staff, who I must say are the most courteous we have come across. The cafe directly opposite also deserves a mention, exactly what we came to paris for, only a couple of small bistro tables outside but nice for a coffee or glass of wine on the way back from our sightseeing, again has that 'homely' feel. The hotel will happily store your luggage if you are travelling back later in the day/evening,

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel France Albion”
Reviews.Author: KareninBoca
Reviews.Content: My sister and I just returned from a one week stay at Hotel France Albion. We loved the neighborhood - you really feel like a resident of Paris! While the rooms aren't large, ours was very comfortable and clean. The staff is wonderful, and all spoke English fluently. I would highly recommend, and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: stace_steve_10
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in Paris a couple of times always in fairly budget hotels and this is by far the best. Really clean, friendliest staff and rooms are comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: TravellerUK160
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stay at this hotel and found it to be far better than it's 2 star rating would have you believe. The hotel is within within easy reach of two Metro Stations and walking distance of most of the main tourist attractions. There are some good restaurants close by too. The room was clean and comfortable with air conditioning. Clean towels were provided everyday as well as the room being cleaned. The staff were a credit to the hotel in that they were very friendly, very helpful and thankfully their English far better than our French. I have stayed in several 2/3 star hotels in Paris and is the best I have found. That good that we are staying there again when we return to Paris in October.

Reviews.Title: “good cheap/value place”
Reviews.Author: jeffiner52
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four days. We found the hotel fairly easy. It is located farther away from the main central area with all the tourist sites, although fairly close to the Montmarte area which is more on the outskirts of Paris. However, there are 3 metro stations, about a 5 min walk away (2 different lines) that through other connections can reach almost anywhere in about 15-20 minutes. The area around the hotel seemed to have more locals than tourists, but seemed very safe, although we didn't go out much at night. Also, there is a small grocery shop right across the street, which was great for cheap snacks and water. The hotel elevator is small, common for Europe, and the rooms are smaller than American hotels, also common for Europe. However, with two of us in a double we still had plenty of room to walk with our luggage laid out. The room was a very clean, basic hotel room. It had 2 nightstands, a double bed, desk and television, as well as a safe in the coat closet. The bathroom was also very clean, and both the room and bathroom were cleaned daily, if you placed the sign on the door. One minor complaint was that the shower. It had no shower curtain, so unless you decided to take a bath, you had to be up against the wall to avoid flooding the floor. Also, the bath walls were high to step out of, which may be hard for some people. Overall, clean and cheap, which made it perfect for us. A nice place to sleep after being out all day sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “A simple gem in the heart of saucy, lively Pigalle”
Reviews.Author: greatstargazer
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but very, very clean and well maintained. There is a small well stocked bar on the ground floor - unusual in a hotel of this size. Breakfast had a wide choice, both hot and cold and the coffee and juices were of very good quality. All of the staff were extremely helpful and courteous and made our stay a memorable experience. The location is excellent with at least two Metro stations nearby and many good restaurants and bistros within easy walking distance. I can thoroughly recommend Caffe Jadis, in the same street as the hotel - 11 rue Notre Dame de Lorette. For more information on this restaurant go to www.caffe-jadis.com where you will find a sample menu and photographs.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fab2Essex
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a very cold May day but the Hotel France Albion was warm and cosy. Very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was excellent with good quality BATH SHEETS and piping hot water. Never venture out for breakfast, the breakfast was beyond belief even included omelette, bacon and fried potatoes!. The staff were very attentive and service excellent. Position for Metro and Monmartre ideal. 2 Star rating but definitely 3 star value.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for your money”
Reviews.Author: Ninav_fin
Reviews.Content: As I stayed in this small little hotel for four nights, and was very pleased, I am writing this review. If you travel, and do not want to spend too much money on expensive hotel nights, this is an exellent choise. Location is good and rooms are small but clean. I asked for a quiet room and got one, so I am more than pleased with the service as well. Since it was unbelivable warm and sunny week in Paris, I didnÂ´t want to eat my breakfasts inside my hotel. Instead I went to boulangerie nearby, to eat breakfast outside with only 6 euros. This hotel is good choise for its location and for shopping, metros are near, the area of Montmartre is just around the corner and also Haussmann area, where the department stores are ( Galeries Laffayette ans Printemps). This hotel is also nearby the Opera house (L`Opera), where you can take a bus to the airport of Charles De Gaulle. Very convinient.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: CherylnPaul
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent value for money - good sized, clean rooms and very friendly and helpful staff. The metro was only a few minutes walk away so very easy for getting into central Paris and the location is safe and pleasant to stay in. Highly recommended for travellers or business people.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely satisfied with our choice”
Reviews.Author: kabana
Reviews.Content: We stayed in France Albion hotel for 3 nights and we were really pleased with our choice. The size of the room was very good and most important it was very clean(towels and bathroom cleaned every day). The only bad things were the noise from street and other rooms (but bear in mind that we had a street view room)and that it didn't have a fridge. The staff was very helpful and polite,we communicated in English with no problem. Two metro stations are just 2 minutes away from the hotel,very good especially for those(like us) who don't know the city and use the metro a lot. The price of the breakfast was quite high (13 euros per person) that is why we always went to the boulangeries just across the street and ate breakfast at half the price. There is also a supermarket,a fromagerie,a boutcherie and a convenience store(until late at night) very close to the hotel.Overall the location was really convenient and safe. I would definitely recommend France Albion to those who want a quite reasonably priced ,clean, convenient hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Great location for Metro. Great staff.”
Reviews.Author: watermaa
Reviews.Content: Business travellers and tourists alike should take note of this hotel, especially if you're tired of the high cost of Parisian hotels. A solid 2-3 star, not a trumped-up 4 star like others. While it's not within easy walking distance of the major tourist sights (down the hill from Pigalle and Montmartre) it is amazingly within a 100 metres of not one but two Metro stations! This was the only hotel we found that could truly accommodate a family that needed 3 seperate beds (2 older kids). They have an ideal 6th floor, 2 bedroom suite without the price tag of a suite. Staff are extremely helpful, and are fully fluent in at least 3 languages (yes, English included).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruthbags
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two night break in Paris. This hotel made our stay a treat to remember. The staff spoke english and were very friendly. Our room was warm and very comfortable. The bathoom very clean with clean towels each day. The hotel is in walking distance to all the tourist spots. Some traffic noise but nothing to worry about, we slept well . Good value hotel. Many Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Small Room, Great Service, Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: dollar327
Reviews.Content: Like most mid-priced rooms in Paris, ours was small. No dresser, but a comfortable bed, nice clean bathroom, and we were fortunate to get a room on the top floor with a view of the eiffel tower way off in the distance. That was very nice. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The location is awesome. Almost everything is walkable. The Eiffel tower is a hike, but there are two Metro stops very close by the hotel. The surroundings are fabulous -- with small markets, wine shops, bakeries, cafes.... ahhh Paris! The breakfast is good, but it does not vary from day to day. There is a small (very small) bar area just off the main lobby, but we did not drink downstairs. Instead we bought a bottle of wine from a shop and the hotel staff were more than happy to open the wine for us and lend us two glasses. We kept the wine outside on the window ledge at night. We had a great stay in Paris, and this hotel was a large part of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special about the room but hey you are in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: MollyandThomasina
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty sparse, small but clean. There was good maid service and the beds were comfortable. The street was noisier than we anticipated and we did hear a lot of traffic. I would recommend asking for a room not facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “splendid hotel”
Reviews.Author: conemanGtown
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at this hotel for 4nights the location for the metro was perfect as was the staff and the room was clean and fresh. The breakfast layout was spot on and the choice plentiful. At the end of each days sightseeing we returned to a cleaned room and helpful friendly staff. The hotel is modern but also cosy and exceeds its 2 star rating , i am fussy but could not find any fault whatsoever so dont pay much heed to other reviews ie no shower curtains or rooms to small. I for one shall be returtung to this good value , well kept and pleasent hotel. Oh and the bar next door is a great place to sit and watch the locals !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Base”
Reviews.Author: Horli34
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 8 nights in september and found it to be a very good, comfortable, clean and value for money hotel. The location is spot on - you can get anywhere from here. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the vicinity as well as metro stops. The rooms are small but clean and comfortable. The staff are unobtrusive and will help when asked. My only gripes are the expensive WiFi and the noise if your room faces out onto the street (both expected in Paris however). Will be staying here again until I can find permanent accomodation!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: InTheory
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor folks seemed to like Hotel Albion and my father and I weren't disappointed. After travelling around France, we needed one night back in Paris and the Hotel Albion seemed well located. The 9th District has very good restaurants and the hotel is very close to the Opera, Galleries Lafayette, and other popular places. The rooms were very comfortable and roomy. Although I spotted some peeling wallpaper, it was a truly minor point. I appreciated the cheap internet, elevator, and cleanliness of the room. On the 5th floor, I heard no noise from the street. This is a great place for business travelers and they have a small conference facility onsite. Not my kind of place to stay for a lengthy visit (I prefer renting apts), but definitely great for in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: nadanath
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Paris in Dec of 2008. Sorry only now got a chance to write the review. We loved everything about this hotel - location, price, staff. The rooms were clean and were redone everyday. Bathroom was small but clean. The carpet in the room seemed a little worn out. But that's just a small thing in an otherwise good hotel. The staff was very friendly and spoke English well. The location is perfect! Very close to the Paris Opera and Galeries Lafayette. Montmartre is a lovely street with great bars and restaurants. My wife and I both love to walk. So we didn't rely on public transport at all. Saw all the major attractions on foot. But there is a train station pretty close to the hotel. All in all, a very good hotel in a great city!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: TennB
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the hotel to be exactly as advertised. The staff was very friendly and helped in any way possible. The rooms are small as expected in Paris for an inexpensive room. The bathroom was an ok size. Certainly both were fine for two people to shower and sleep. Too much to do in Paris to sit around in a hotel room. We had another couple and a single person with us and all three rooms were fine. We were on the back side, one was on the front. None of us had any problems with noise. The rooms (and the rest of the hotel) were very clean. They have a small lift which was nice for us "older folks" staying on the fifth floor. The location is not the very best, but it is not bad. The buses and subway have stops very close by. There are a couple of very good pastry/fruit stands right around the corner and a small grocery store almost directly across the street where we bought drinks for the room. Also, the hotel has a small bar right off the registration area. If you ask, they will be glad to give you a bucket of ice for your room! A very nice surprise for those of us who think we must have ice for water or soft drinks. Only real downer was that they had no English speaking TV stations. I like to listen to the news in the morning and go to sleep to the sound of the TV, so that was a little disappointing. All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone. My son has stayed here twice and recommended it to us. It is very clean and they have an excellent staff that is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaUnitedfan
Reviews.Content: Yes, the rooms are very small, but this is Paris! This small 2 star hotel is in a great location, walk to Montmartre, Opera Area in 10 minutes, 30 to the other attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent English. The room was on the top floor (there is a small elevator!), and was very clean. Beds are comfortable, has a small TV, small bathroom.. but let's face it - this is Paris - there is so much to see you shouldn't be sitting in a hotel room during the day! Lovely places to eat and drink all around. I would happily stay here again...Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a great area.”
Reviews.Author: roonaldo73
Reviews.Content: We'll just spent our 10th Wedding Anniversary here for two-nights over the weekend, and have nothing but praise for the staff, lcoation and accomodation. FIrst point - location, location, location! This place is fantastic if you want to be on the doorstep of sensational Montmartre. It reminded me a little of London's Soho with it's little pavement-sdie bars and restaurants, yet was more romantic and more, well, Parisian! The hotel is also surrounded by a vast array of lovely independent boutiques and magnificant bakeries, fruit stalls, wineries, fishmongers etc. There's also a handy supermarket across the road where we'd stock up on beer/water for our coolbag for our trips into the centre each day (saved us a fortune doing so!). We arrived on Eurostar, which also added weight to the location, as it was just a 20min (safe) stroll from Gard du Nord. Now for the hotel. Firstly, I've given it a 4, rather than a 5, because I've stayed in better places in other european cities. However, for Paris this would definetly be a '5', as, like in London, you will find it almost impossible to find a reasonably priced hotel in a great location not far from the centre (bar a Premier Inn/Travelodge). The room was clean and well presented. It had a smart tv that had french, italian, german and spanish channels on offer, along with BBC World. The staff were all very friendly, and were all good english speakers (though I'd urge you to at least try a little pigeon-french). The room was a little small to say it was a superior double, and whilst we could just about view the eiffel tower (we had an inside courtyard room on the top floor) it wasn't much of a view. I'm being picky though, as, again, you must remember that this is a review of a reasonably priced Parisian hotel. Some earlier reviews have suggested that it could be very noisy round the front, but I can only say that we didn't notice it being that busy on the road out front, and as the rooms have air-con, it shouldn't be a problem. Oh, I would also like to thank the staff for our upgrade. Upon arrival we were given the best Superior Double, which was such a lovely gesture to kick off our special weekend. In conclusion, I would highly recommend the France Albion.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller3204
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 night at Hotel Albion. It was our second stay in Paris for our trip, previously we had been on the Left Bank. This location was quite different with access to many of the Paris sights. The hotel is situated very close to the local metro with a supermarket opposite and within walking distance of plenty of restaurants. They is a great bar a couple of doors away also. The staff were very welcoming on arrival and offered plenty of advice when needed. The room was adequate, fairly small and not a lot of room to move, but then we didn't spend any time in the room as we were out sight seeing most of the day. There was a large sized bathroom with bath and the rooms were serviced daily. We were on the 3rd floor and a room facing the street. The elevator was quite slow at times, but we really only used it for transporting of cases. The room had airconditioning which was quite noisy, but it was not possible to have the windows open at night because of the street traffic noise. Maybe a room at the back would be better. There was no bar fridge - the fridge would have been very handy as the weather was pretty hot and cold water to take out sight seeing would have been good. Breakfast was served in the basement area and was OK, nothing outstanding. Great location but a bit noisy facing the street, wouldn't be a problem in winter as you would not want to open the window.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CJ525
