Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel at the beginning of April, 09. From the moment we arrived the staff made us feel welcome. Lovely area, very close to metro station, about 2 min walk (Could take longer if you cannot resist the beautiful bakery!) Room was a nice size, bathroom was adequate, with several toiletries. Room service was top class, every day our room was cleaned, fresh towels, toilitries and fresh linen. Cannot praise this hotel high enough!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Voyageur37
Reviews.Content: I had planned to stay 3 nights but checked out after one. I was given a claustrophobic walk-in closet of a room on the 5th floor, with a very slow elevator the size of a coffin. When trying to phone out, I got a busy signal each time but the evening clerk said there was nothing wrong. The next morning, another clerk found the phone was not connected. When I stated that I was leaving early because the situation wasn't to my liking, the clerk was going to charge me for an additional night anyway. (She didn't, after I challenged this.) I was also disappointed in the availability of restaurants in the area. The charges for Internet and breakfast were very high (13 euros for breakfast; however, there's a great bar/cafe next door). Since this was my 11th trip to Paris and I am quite familiar with various areas, to have an experience like this was a surprise. (See "Hotel Innova" review for one that I highly recommend.)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay for my First Trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: Laura12989
Reviews.Content: Don't even think twice about booking this hotel, it's ideal for a long weekend sightseeing in Paris. I booked this hotel with Eurostar tickets through the Eurostar website it cost us Â£160 each for 4 nights and return eurostar. My partner and I stayed in the Hotel France Albion for 4 nights in late December. It was absolutely perfect for what we wanted, a base for a sightseeing long weekend in Paris. The location was very good, was within walking distance from Gare du Nord, It's about a 1 minute walk to the nearest metro, opposite a medium sized convenience store, has plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. We didn't eat in the hotel at all because the prices seemed a bit steep, there is a lovely little boulangerie in the next street which met our breakfast requirements perfectly. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful, we had no problems at all, they even let us keep our bags at reception after we checked out so that we didn't have to carry them around on our last day of sightseeing. The rooms were cleaned to a very high standard every day. Very good value for money. Our room was on the top floor of the hotel facing the street, it was surprisingly quiet in our room for such a busy area. The room was always at a perfect temperature which was ideal because it was very cold outside when we visited so it was lovely to come back to a nice clean, warm room. I would definately stay here again if the oportunity arose to visit Paris again. TIP: The windowsil makes an excellent beer chiller in the winter months!!

Reviews.Title: “Great economy hotel, clean!”
Reviews.Author: megumi203
Reviews.Content: You use Paris Metro Line 12 (Green line) and get off at Notre-Dame-de-Lorette station, then it's very easy to find. It's very cheap but the room is super clean and neat. Bathtab was quite big for the small room! The room was sure small (especially hotel hallway) but it's great economy hotel. Stuff at the check-in counter were pretty nice too. The road in front was a bit noisy from late at night to the early morning. But you have a supermarket right across the street and cute&yummy bakery on the corner. Within 30 seconds of walking, you can get on Paris Metro to go anywhere. They only have body&shampoo (conbination one), shoe cleaner, hair drier and soap. You may want to consider bringing more.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, Clean, Close to Metro”
Reviews.Author: DandAinNYC
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Albion Hotel for a weekend holiday in Paris. The room was very clean, and there was enough comfortable space for 2 people. The hotel wasn't as close to most of the places we visited as we would've liked, but there was a metro just a short walk away. This was definitely a better value than any other place I've stayed at in Paris, and would recommend it to anyone going who wants a nice place and to save money!

Reviews.Title: “Second time- just gets better”
Reviews.Author: Shauliz
Reviews.Content: On July 2007 I stayed in Hotel France Albion with my young cousin as part of a flight + hotel deal on her first visit to Eurodisney. Yesterday I came back from my honeymoon which I booked directly through the hotel website. You can understand how pleased I was with the hotel. Reception staff are the friendliest french people I have ever met. We arrived at the hotel at 11.30 pm with great suspicion since I only booked the hotel the night before. The receptionist was expecting us with the room key, a big smile and friendly reception giving us directions to place du tertre for a night coffee. The room (#50) was decent size and the bathroom almost as big as the room. Perfectly clean, housekeeping everyday, 4 towels, 3 hand towels and 2 bathrobes. Digital television (french only) and a small button to switch you to analogue mode with BBC and CNBC between various European channels. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel this time but as far as I remember from last time it was quite good. Since the room faces the opposite side from the street it couldn't be more quiet by night. We also returned to the room for a 2 hour nap every afternoon and weren't disturbed even once (besides a false fire alarm on the first morning which can happen anywhere). Best value for your money! 5 nights this time and will certainly be back at this gem!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BassettTwickenham
Reviews.Content: First time to Paris and the Hotel France Albion was a great place to stay. Very good location. The staff were always polite and smiley. Our room was fine and comfortable and the shower/bath great. Only downside was the noise from the road. Cars and motorbikes tearing up and down late into the night and starting again early morning. Thank god for earplugs! Having said that I would recomend the Albion.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: otk25
Reviews.Content: Hotel is well located. 3 min walk to metro, 15-20 min walk to Montmartre, and 15 min walk to Opera to catch a bus to airport. Gare du Nord is 10 min ride by bus 43. Hotel is clean and well kept. Personnel is friendly, helpful and speaks good English in case if you are stranger to French. Rooms are typical european rooms with A/C and adjustable heating. Bathroom is clean and good size. My room was facing the street, but noise was bearable. Breakfast is good and hearty (eggs, meats, cheeses, cereals) and served in cute basement, which used to be a cellar. Room safe is also helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MarkZaff
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Paris Albion Hotel for 7 nights in December and found this hotel exactly as it was described in the website - Simple yet nice and comfortable and very clean. Prior to our arrival I confirmed my reservation with the hotel staff and asked whether we could have 2 double superior rooms instead of 2 twin superior rooms. The reception staff, which speaks very good English, quicly replied that our request could be met and everything was confirmed. Upon our arrival we found the rooms we requested and the receptionist gave us a map showing the metro and the many sights of Paris. Rooms aren't big, but have comfortable beds, a flat screen TV and a good bathroom. The only negative point on the rooms is that the 'closet' is very small especially for 2 persons. Other than that everything was very good, including central heating. The staff cleaned the room perfectly every day and changed the linen, towels, soap etc every day as well. During our stay the hotel had a small problem with the heating service which meant that the heating in the rooms (including water) was off during one night but by the morning the problem was solved and of course this was not the hotel's fault. Breakfast is served in the breakfast room downstairs and is worth the money. In fact you get a good english breakfast including scrambled eggs and bacon together with various types of cured meats, cheese, jams, juices, cereals, tea, coffee, etc. The staff here are also very helpful (although they know less English than the reception staff). The hotel is situated in a very good area which is full of good restaurants without being too busy nor noisy. There are 2 metro stations (ST George and Notre Dame de Lorette) which are practically 1 minute away from which you can get to all the attractions of Paris. By foot you can easily get to Montmatre, Sacre Ceur and Opera Garnier area. I would advise anyone who wants to stay in a simple very good hotel to visit Paris to go ahead and book the Albion.

Reviews.Title: “Real Paris (i think?)”
Reviews.Author: Mir222
Reviews.Content: I am definetely going back to Hotel France Albion!!! I stayed in a standard double with my boyfriend for 3 nights in Oct 2008. The room itself was basic but comfortable however the main drawcard was the location. It's convenient enough to the main sights (5 min walk to metro or if you're energetic you can walk to the lourve) but also away from all the tourists so you feel like you're really in the heart of parisian life. One street over there are fantastic bakeries & fruit markets for a cheap eat. Plus you can walk up the hill to Abbesses where there are some funky cafes & shops. The room itself had a comfy bed, double glazed windows (we had no probs with noise), ensuite bathroom, tv. By no means luxurious... but very practical. We really enjoyed our stay & I would totally recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “clean, safe and friendly”
Reviews.Author: gingerpu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary with a first-time trip to London, Paris and Brussels. While searching for a hotel in Paris, we looked to www.tripadvisor.com for advice. Sure glad we did. We picked the Hotel France Albion based on the favorable reviews posted on the site. Booking was a breeze. We went to the hotel's website and they responded very quickly. Our plans changed and we had to move back our arrival date. Fabulous Fabienne assured us that would be no problem, and there would be no extra charge. She and Kelly (this hotel has plenty of friendly, competent staff) helped us complete our tourist visa requirements by faxing a confirmation of our booking directly to the French Embassy in Manila, and supplied us a copy through our travel agent. We doubt many other hotels would do that. The room was small but very clean. We requested a non-smoking room and that's exactly what they gave us. We stayed at a double room with bath on an upper floor. Looking out the window, we had a bonus glimpse of the Eiffel Tower. We did have to look past tin roofs which were not exactly pleasing to the eye, but as long as we gazed upward and towards the Eiffel, the view was okay. We used the in-room safe, and even though we did not leave all our valuables there, we felt very secure and protected. Every morning we'd leave the room key with the front desk, and Fabienne would always give us the weather forecast for the day. We'd come back from our sightseeing at past 11pm. We never felt unsafe walking the few meters from the St. Georges metro station to the hotel. We skipped the breakfast option and instead bought delicious croissants, etc. at a boulangerie a short distance from the Notre Dame de Lorette metro station. It's on a narrow street by the side of the church. Around the corner is a Monop grocery and a mini grocery store from where we got our supply of bottled water for the duration of our stay. The hotel is walking distance to the Opera and Montmartre area. Since we arrived from London via Eurostar at Gare du Nord station, we just walked to the hotel. The website said it takes only 15 minutes, but since we were not familiar with the area and had to stop several times to check our map, it took us 30 minutes walking at a very easy pace. We had a great time in Paris, thanks in part to this wonderful hotel. Would we stay there again if we returned to Paris? Definitely!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Staff I have encountered in my travels.”
Reviews.Author: GaeilgeIreland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in September when I visited Paris on a weekend break. The Hotel got very good reviews on this and other sites hence the reason I chose it. I was not disappointed, it was in a great location with the metro station St George just a two minute walk away or if you preferred a 10 minute walk would take you to the Opera House. We availed of both options having purchased a two day pass for the Hop on Hop off sightseeing bus one of the stops was at the Opera House. We were very pleased with the Hotel, the rooms though small ( we were expecting this) the bathroom was a good size and everything was in working order no complaints at all. We had breakfast two mornings we found it to be a bit pricey (at â‚¬12 each ) for what was on offer. We found some nice little restaurants in the vicinity of the Hotel and a large supermarket that sold all the familiar toileteries, water, chocolate etc. But I will say that the staff at this Hotel made a huge impression on me they were so helpful and friendly. On our farrival at the hotel just as we got to reception to check in I discoverd that I had left my mobile phone in the taxi, I was devastated as like most people my phone is like an extra hand to me, the young man on duty that night ( I must apologise I cannot recall his name) couldnt have been more helpful, he used his own mobile to send a text message in French to my phone in case somebody picked it up, he rang and rang my phone but to no avail. I did make contact with O2 in Ireland suspended the service on my phone . As I had it insured I was required to report the loss to the French Police, the next day the young lady on duty in reception kindly typed up a letter (in French ) for me to take to the Police station outling what I required, this proved to be so helpful for me as it only took me 10 minutes in the Police station to get the required form. This Hotel is a little gem with its staff its crowning glory, I will be back and I will be recommending it to family and friends who will be visiting this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: mayortony
Reviews.Content: You can add a star to the rating if a small room doesn't bother you. Actually, even though the room was small, it was well planned out so you didn't feel crammed in. Nice size bathroom. We felt the 120-Euro double was well worth the price. The room came with many amenities, such as "his and hers" terrycloth robes, hair dryer, plenty of good shampoo and soap, nice supply of large, fluffy towels and excellent maid service. A very friendly and helpful front desk. Location is also good, about halfway between Montmartre and the Opera Garnier (walking distance to both) - one block to Metro (Notre Dame de Lorette). Breakfast is not included and is an additional 12 Euros per person. We opted to have breakfast at nearby cafe for 8 Euros. We enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean room.”
Reviews.Author: geangulo
Reviews.Content: I was making a stop over in Paris from the 23 to 26 sept,2008, 3 nights. I choose this hotel based in the good reviews I found. The reservation: Fast and trouble free in their own web-site but somehow non of the discounts advertised in the rates page applied to me. When I asked why, the person in charge got defensive and said that there is a explanatory note that states that "during some special periods" they may have this discounts but not in september. Although it does not says when. You have to pay a one night deposit and there is a charge for cancelling the reservation. The room: Adequate size for a single room in Paris. Nice bathroom. I really believe that the cleaning crew makes an excellent job and the bathroom is restocked daily. The service: The day front desk is average, the night one very helpful and exact with the wake-up calls. No help to assist you with the suitcases at the arrival or departure. I was not able to program the safe in my room therefore I decided not to use it. I did not make use of the breakfast service. Check-out: They offer to charge you in Dollars but check the exchange rate before you decide. The price is good for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff = Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lizvt1
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Hotel France Albion was really great! They planned trips for us to take and would call around to get us into the things we really wanted to see.... we had decided that we would wait until we got there to try to book the appointments, which is a bad idea, but the staff made it happen for us! We went on a very romantic river dinner boat cruise on the seine which was amazing plus we got to take in a show at the Moulin Rouge which was very entertaining and not trashy at all. You can walk to the Moulin Rouge from the hotel... plus we loved a dining facility near the hotel that they suggested yummy yummy yummy... it was a little pricy but soooo good! The staff spoke English well and was great. Only things we did not enjoy about staying at this hotel was that we did have to get on the metro station a lot to see the major sites, we witnessed people peeing on the street as we walked home two nights in a row, we were not in a high tourist part of town so the locals in a grocery store hated us, we had to leave our hotel key with the front desk every time we left which made us a little nervous, and the hotel was not easy to find if you did not get off the metro at the exact stop. I would suggest staying in this hotel because of the staff because the two women we dealt with were wonderful!! They were perfect and made the experience awesome. Even with the few negatives I listed above I would stay at this hotel again because we are young and did not mind some of the things that went on that were not so wonderful. The pros overcome the cons!

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal in Paris”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl604
Reviews.Content: The Albion is a good value hotel in Paris. It is clean, the rooms are a decent size and the staff were very friendly. The hotel is located very close to a metro/subway stop, making it easy to get around. Many sites are also within walking distance (Opera is very close). The staff allowed us to change our reservation by one night for no fee when our plans changed. They also made a few phone calls helping us to find a certain restaurant. The shower was clean and the water was hot. Shower gel and other soap is provided. I would ask for a room with a courtyard view. We had two windows facing an inner courtyard which was pretty and quiet. This hotel isn't fancy or elaborate, but it is a great deal in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a 2 Star”
Reviews.Author: MSoft
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect and our first room was really small but very clean. Maid service was very good. We did have alot of noise as we were facing the street. Bring earplugs and you'll be okay. The location is very good. Lots of great shops nearby and within walking distance of many great neighbourhoods. The staff is friendly. The night staff is the friendlist I've ever encountered and that's rare! I wish I knew the name of the fellow on night duty when we checked out - this guy is the best! Some rooms are larger so if you're looking for more space consider upgrading. One room we were in did smell like cigarette smoke which I believe is permitted in this hotel. I'm not sure if they have non-smoking rooms. It's a good little hotel for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Tha Absolute Best!”
Reviews.Author: JackGoPack
Reviews.Content: I believe any good review should be prefaced with a little about the reviewer so as to gauge probable caution used in determining a choice of stay. That said, my wife and I are in our early 50's, upper middle-class professionals, frequent US travelers (first time Europe) with tastes ranging from Broadway to Wal-Mart... sushi to McDonalds. We're fun-loving but have little desire to abode with/near the rascals of the world just to save a $ (learned long ago that it's not worth your life). We're not puritans or prudes... just real people who can, at our age, buy our way out of steerage if warranted. That said, we love to find a metro area base camp whose "musts" are 1) safety, 2) cleanliness, 3) vicinity and 4) value, then trek all day and night. I am so very pleased to report that this hotel meets all those requirements AND MORE and is an easy walk/metro ride to everything! Having stayed in many nice properties while on business, this one holds its own and is quiet to boot. The hotel and rooms are small (compared to US... but plenty big enough) and clean. The Manager and staff were EXTREMELY personable (all in English), jovial, professional, attentive and courteous. The hotel door (single entrance) is locked late at night (just knock) as a precautionary measure, which I loved, however we never ONCE felt at ease walking around the entire Montmarte/Paris area... even Pigalle at midnight (touristy=safety). I was amazed. I was also really glad that we got out of the heart of Paris... Montmartre was SO much more alive and indicative of everyday French living. Folks this hotel, its personnel, its surrounding area and its value are a slam dunk/no brainer. Don't think twice.. just book it and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maidenfan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel France Albion and found it a very pleasant place to stay. The surrounding area is safe and quiet at night and it's only a couple of hundred yards from the nearest Metro station. Having read previous reviews, I was pleasantly suprised at the size of the double room with ensuite bathroom. The bedroom had a double bed, small built-in wardrobe and table and two chairs. The bed seemed a little hard initially but we slept very well every night and awoke with no aches or pains. There was also an in room safe but we did not use this. The bathroom had a (very small) bath, over bath shower, toilet and basin with soap and shampoo and even shoe-shine!! Breakfast was available but we did not have this. The room was cleaned daily to a high standard and the lobby, lift and stairways were always clean. The staff were always pleasant and in my opinion the only thing I really would have liked was tea/coffee facilities in the room.

Reviews.Title: “If we go to Paris again we would return to this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KopolJunam
Reviews.Content: We chose the France Albion because of the high ranking on this website. My wife had her doubts because it is only rated 2 stars but I guess this is because of the size of the rooms. Our room was small but not too small for a long weekend. It had a small closet with a free safe which I appreciated. The bathroom was comparably big and even had a tub. The temperature and pressure of the shower could easily be adjusted. Everything was very clean and it wasn't very noisy but not totally quiet either. The location of the place is very convenient. There are metro stations of two different lines very close and there are many restaurants, bars and shops within 5-10 minutes walking distance. Within 15-20 minutes walking distance you can get to the big department stores as well as to the Place Pigalle area. Even Montmartre can easily be done by foot . For a longer stay the room and its closet might be a little too small but for a stay of a few days this is really a very good choice. If we return to Paris (which we will hopefully) we will certainly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Neggy
Reviews.Content: Just back from Hotel France Albion in Paris. I must say that this was the smallest room I have been to in my entire life, and that it was quite funny when we walked in. But once you get used to the size, it is actually really cosy. The hotel is close to the drop off of the Roissy Bus from Charles de Gaulle airport. It is in the 9th arrondissement, and so it is in a very good location, in terms of access to the tourist attractions. It is between 2 subway stations, and both are a 2 minute walk. There is a small supermarket across the road, where you can stock up on water, wine and other necessities. A good bottle of wine is about 4 euros, the same price as an expresso coffee! I recommend the hotel, mostly beacuse it is a bit out of the busy and noisy areas of Paris, yet it is so close to everything. Taking a recommendation from a previous reviewer, I asked for a room on the top floor, and had a view of the Eiffel tower, which gave us a nice light show for ten minutes every hour from 9pm- midnight. Very romantic!!! It is true that we need to leave our key at the reception, but nothing went missing from our room, and it was cleaned very well every day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel France Albion, a great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: mantonandkylie
Reviews.Content: Hotel France Albion was great. Being a two star hotel, we weren't sure what to expect, but were pleasantly surprised with our double room which was tidy and clean, with a nice bathroom. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful and they let us leave our luggage in the hotel after checking out. The subway is literally one minute's walk from the hotel and Montmarte about 10-15 mins walk. The hotel is also surrounded by restaurants and convenience stores. Perfect location and a great economical place to stay. Apart from our room smelling a bit smokey, no other complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Destinys_Journey
Reviews.Content: Nice bright clean newly decoreated hotel. Day staff were really helpful, guy who' s on in the evening less so. (Mind you I miss the quirky Paris 2 star hotels of the past ,with sloping floors and toilets situated as you opened the room door, not to mention steaming cisterns as the toilet was on the same pipe as the shower. There's nothing memorable about this place) The strong Euro worked against us though; having paid for 1 night on booking, with the remainder to be paid on check out, the room cost Â£10 per night more than when we booked it. C'est la vie!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little hotel, good area”
Reviews.Author: AnnaOxford
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 4 days at this hotel which is at the bottom of the hill on which The Sacre Coeur stands. Lots of bars/restaurants locally. As other reviews have already said - it is very clean, excellent value for a two star. The hot and cold buffet breakfast was good value at the special offer rate of 10 euros, when you consider that a small coffee in a cafe can cost 3.50 euros. Breakfast is served in a very characterful breakfast room. We did not find traffic noise to be a problem, and we are used to silence at night. It is not a main road, 'though it is a road which is used for access and therefore there is traffic going by, but in February the road was quiet between midnight and 6.30am. There are two metro stations very close by, but we did not use them at all, as it was quite possible to walk to all of the main attractions and was only 20 minutes from The Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: eightsweek
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in a good location, good breakfast friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Average 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: oxxygen
Reviews.Content: Bought 1 night here along with Eurostar ticket as a package. Not bad at all, but for 70-80 euro you can probably find better place. As a summary... Pros: close to metro, not far from de Nord train station, not expensive, clean room Cons: quite long time to walk to the center, bad noise isolation, small room (single has single bed, not more) Next time I would probably find more interesting place to stay ))

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: grb65
Reviews.Content: Hotel France Albion is an excellent 2star class hotel centrally located in Paris and with very convenient connections from there. For the price, it is 'value for money!'. The hotel is well maintained - clean and neat - and the rooms too are taken care of properly. The staff are quite courteous and speak proper English too. One improvement can be done - of keeping coffee/tea bags and kettle - in room at least in the 'superior' rooms!

Reviews.Title: “SO CUTE!-Great Location...very clean!!”
Reviews.Author: Colombianita201
Reviews.Content: The location is great--a short block away from the metro...the staff is super friendly--very willing to give advise and help in anyway. The hotel could not have been any cleaner or cuter. It is not a luxury hotel with tons of space-in fact it is a little small but by no means cramped. In fact i think it's size added to its charm... I highly highly recomend!!! It met and surpassed my expectations by far!

Reviews.Title: “Best Paris 2 Star I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Another-fine-mess
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value, great breakfast what more could you want

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Thrifty_TravellerOz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for just over a week from Xmas 07 into the new year. I thought it was good value for the money (EUR 100/120 per night for a twin) and we even got a new year card and a bottle of champagne! Overall it was a good experience and I'd certainly consider staying again. Overall Pros: + Location - close to Montmartre, Louvre and the gardens. Main shopping district with Galeries Lafayette and Printemps (famous department stores) is a short walk away. + Transport - metro station is just down the street + Food - bakeries, grocers etc are just round the corner. Supermarket 20m from front door. + Staff generally helpful and spoke English. Cons: - Room is a bit small (typical for Paris though) - Pricey breakfast (EUR 12), not worth it with bakery close by - Wifi expensive, PC in lobby is cheaper and has free printing though - Someone mentioned the lift and staircase - small and cramped lifts and staircases seem to be the norm for this grade of hotel in France as they're mainly in converted apartments built decades ago.

Reviews.Title: “First family trip to Paris”
Reviews.Author: SilverFox_8
Reviews.Content: We were looking for somewhere to stay that provided comfort and value and were not disappointed with the France Albion. Its locations is also excellent being in easy reach of many good restaurants in Montmartre and convenient for the main tourist sites.

Reviews.Title: “France Albion: decent hotel, interesting location”
Reviews.Author: travelproGhent
Reviews.Content: Clean room of good size, some signs of refurbishing in bathroom, large enough bed, correct staff. Only negative points: no separate luggage room, you have to leave your luggage in a conference room right next to the entrance. We locked ours to the heating pipes because, basically, any one could walk in from the street and grab it. The promised bath robes were not present in the superior room and were "not available" when asked for at the front desk. Overall, a very decent hotel for Paris, the price was ok (90 euros/night when booked directly via internet, autumn promotion - didn't take the breakfast because cheaper in bakeries), the neighbourhood is safe and conveniently located: easy 20-minute walk to Louvre / Montmartre, there are two metro stops nearby, 15 minute walk to Gare du Nord. Baker, butcher, pharmacist behind the corner. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Decorated , very comfrtable hotel”
Reviews.Author: shalom18
Reviews.Content: Centrally located , I would give it a 3 star PLUS for quality rooms , clean and comfortable , fair rates , friendly staff newly refurbished , and better nicer rooms than nearby hotels

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: LondonStoofa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for two nights with my boyfriend and loved every minute of it. We had a double room on the top floor with plenty of space for us and our bags. Bathroom was spotless and well equiped with complimentary bathrobes and toiletries which were replaced daily. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke good english. The hotel is within walking distance of all the main paris attractions and eurostar terminal and is situated between two metro stations. We didn't eat at the hotel as there are so many cafes and restaurants in the area. The only slight downside was the very narrow staircase up to the room and the lift which is very small and lurches. This hotel is worth so much more than it's two stars and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: gracso
Reviews.Content: We stayed at one suite for three days and everything was delightful. Clean room, very spacious, quiet neighborhood, kind service....and very cheap compared with the nearby hotels. If we ever come back to Paris, we'll stay at the same hotel without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Paris”
Reviews.Author: manderman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with my wife for 3 nights. Worth much more than 2 star!!. The rooms are clean, warm and comfortable. Booked the hotel thro Eurostar and only 25 mins walk from the Gare Du Nord station. The staff are extremely helpfull and friendly. The breakfast is buffet style and excellent. All in all, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great, reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: jessz47
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were very happy with our week-long stay at this hotel. Easy walking distance to pretty much everything on the right bank. Very clean room. Friendly staff, happy to take a phone message from a friend. Would certainly stay here again, especially with good deal through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: Chorleyreview
Reviews.Content: This is a clean hotel with very friendly staff. It doesn't pretend to be anything else and doesn't charge high prices. They did mess our booking up but were very quick to rectify it, and offer free breakfast in return. The rooms are small but vary throughout the hotel - our suggestions would be to view the room first - they seem to have alternatives and are happy to oblige. It is a good base for sight seeing, about 30 minutes walk from the Louvre, 15 minutes from "shops" and 15 minutes from the Mulin Rouge. It is near to the Metro - we didn't use it though as we enjoy walking. There are many cheap, ok restaurants near by and the two local supermarkets sold cheap wine etc. We took a travel kettle and coffee, tea etc plus a cork screw and the staff didn't seem to mind! If you want a cheap base in Paris so you have more money to spend out and don't want to get bed bugs and want a smile from the staff - look no further!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Boogaloo_Jo
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Albion are pleasant and clean. The staff are very friendly and helpful and someone is available 24 hours a day. The breakfast is a ok and the hotel generally feels safe and secure. I have stayed at the Albion three times now because I think it's very good value for money. You cant beat the location because it's very close to the Metro station and is on one of the most central lines. The museums are easily navigable using the underground. It is a very short walk to the big stores (Galleries Lafayette and Printemps) as well as being very near to the Gare du Nord. The streets around the Albion have to be seen both during the day and in the evening. In the daytime the streets are lined with shops and stalls selling the most beautiful fresh food and wine you have ever seen. There are boutiques, supermarkets and a couple of cinemas nearby too. There are plenty of nice places to have lunch. In the evening, you will be surrounded by restaurants of many cultures. There's a lot of al fresco restaurants and also some very nice bars. I consider myself to be a regular customer at the Albion.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in great location”
Reviews.Author: isf7boa
Reviews.Content: Just spend 3 nights at the France Albion and would definietly come back to stay again. Great location 2 mins walk from both St Georges and Notre Dame de Lorette Metro stops. Staff very helpful and speak english. Rooms are small (it is Paris!) but well kept and equipped with nice bathrooms. Breakfast was better than any other similar category Parisien hotel I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our trip”
Reviews.Author: BonBon0726
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of our United Airlines package and it was perfect for our needs. Clean and in a safe location. Rooms were adequate size, in fact our bathroom was huge. Maid everyday to make our beds and give us new towels. Two Metro stops rigjht nearby. Staff is friendly and speak English and put up with me trying to speak French. We had a "courtyard" room (courtyard is size of my thumb) but when you are in Paris are you spending your time in your hotel room or out and about in the city? Our breakfast was included in the cost but 12 E for breakfast was a bit high. ESPECIALLY since the dollar is worth about as much as a piece of paper. Wait let me clarify, the dollar is worth as much as toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Great, great place!”
Reviews.Author: Danish_traveller2
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel - only 34 rooms - with an excellent service, perfect location, small but very good rooms and a nice breakfast that exceeds what you normally would expect in France. The hotel is newly renovated and the staff here is very helpfull, friendly and speak English. We stayed at the 5 floor - and even though we were facing the street we were not bothered by the street noise (not at all). The location is excellent and we will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Hilary-and-Mark
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel. Five of us stayed at the France Albion for three nights. The rooms were reasonably sized for Paris, and nicely fitted out. The hotel doesn't have many facilities, but that suited us - we wanted to be out visiting Paris. We didn't try the breakfast - at â‚¬12 it's a bit pricey, but not unusually so for Paris hotels. With so many great cafes within just a step, we had plenty of excellent, cheap alternatives. There's a fantastic boulangerie a block away. The little cafe at the bottom of the street, facing the back of Notre Dame de Lorette is excellent too, and the people who run it are really nice. The location of the hotel is great. It wasn't my first choice, but it worked really well for us - at the heart of the 9th arrondissement. There are two metro stations within a very short step, so it's quick to get everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “did not care”
Reviews.Author: v169fbk
Reviews.Content: Just come home two day early from this hotel managed to get our travel agent eurostar to bring us home early. Hotels fire sensors going off every 75 seconds outside our room reported this in the afternoon following day when we left about 9.15 following morning sensors still ringing every 75 seconds. My husband and I got no sleep all night and thanks to no rooms being availble thanks to the rugby world cup could not change rooms. Hotel did not seem too bothered that we had to put up with this noise all night. Nice hotel but would not recommend hey do not care about the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but LOUD street noise”
Reviews.Author: OceanLiz
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a great price. The room was spacious by Parisien standards and very clean. The front desk spoke great English and was very courteous. The only draw back was the noise from the street was very loud at night. Great location only 1 block from the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “Had a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: JalanManis
Reviews.Content: Strategic location, close to Gare du Nord hence convenient when traveling on the Thalys. Besides that close to two metro stations less then 5 minutes walk, good for those who's partner hates to walk!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: jhgUk
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a lot of things in its favour. It's very conveniently located, almost within sight of the St Georges metro station. The room we stayed in was very clean, especially the bathroom, which put the bathrooms of some 4-star hotels I've stayed in to shame. The staff were friendly and helpful, the area was pleasant and we always felt safe when coming and going to and from the hotel. The price of the room was good and there's a very handy little supermarket across the street for drinks and snacks. So why only three stars? One word: noise. There is some external noise if your room is located on the street-facing side of the hotel, but no more than you'd expect in a busy city like Paris. It's the noise from inside the hotel that's the real problem. During our visit we were treated to all manner of nocturnal disturbances, including a woman yodelling, laughing and shouting into the early hours, and shrieking from the upper floors the cause of which I wouldn't like to imagine. On top of this, there's the constant door slamming. The rooms have the kind of doors you might find in office buildings, and have no sound insulation whatsoever. Whenever anyone slammed their door (and our fellow guests seemed incapable of simply closing their doors) the sound would travel through the entire building. Not much help after midnight when you're trying to sleep. Basically, if you can sleep through any amount of racket or are prepared to invest in a set of industrial strength ear-plugs then this could be the perfect Parisian hotel for you. However, if noise is something that's going to bother you, you might want to look at other options. It's a shame really, as this one aspect lets down what would otherwise be a real gem of a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A LITTLE gem”
Reviews.Author: AllanKyle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights. Single rooms a wee bit small but en suite shower room more than adequate. Rooms at front have nice street views and street noises. Rooms at back have no view but no noise. Room staff very attentive and efficient. Breakfasted on two days and at the reduced price of 10 Euros was good value for Paris. Staff were all very friendly with good English, although the night porter did appear to spend the night asleep. One of his jobs,I would assume, was to close the fire doors on each floor at night, but as with many hotels abroad this was never done. Close to metros, buses and train stations making all the sights easily accessable. We had the open topped bus pass for two days (covers four seperate routes), and a metro pass for two days. Both worked out well but maybe a one day bus pass would have sufficed as many of the sights were accessable on foot from the hotel. The ' bar' area is very small and the 'patio' area even smaller, really just an outside corridor with plants. Will probabley stay at this hotel again next year.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic little hotel”
Reviews.Author: rexmundi59
Reviews.Content: booked hotel because of reviews on trip advisor.I was not disappointed .Friendly engish speaking reception staff,very clean small rooms,cleaned every day,towels replaced everyday, free electronic room safe.Did not try breakfast as not a breakfast person.Good air con in rooms essential as road outside noisy.Only fifteen mins walk fron gare de nord.2 mins to notre dame de llorette metro station.Would use again ( i am planning to do so next year)

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Expat_Girl25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly centrally located, close to a metro station and not too far from Gare du Nord. The rooms are basic yet kept very clean. For the price you cannot expect anything better in central Paris. We booked through Venere and when we arrived our rooms were not the ones we expected, they were sufficient though. Internet is 7 euro for half an hour, which is not really what you want to pay just to do online check in!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but habitable”
Reviews.Author: DarkRevan
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 11 nights (yep thats right 11) at this hotel and I'd have to say it was rather pleasant. Its true that the accommodation is very spartan, slightly cramped (it's inner Paris after all) and the decor style resembles that of a motel but the basic amenities of a Parisian hotel are there; air condition, TV (BBC News was the only English channel though), double glazed windows (I had street facing room), toilet & shower, safe and a firm bed. I stayed away from the rather expensive 12 Euro breakfast but that saving was nullified by the 10 Euro per hour rate for using the lobby internet computer. Unfortunately I didn't bring my laptop and hence couldn't utilize the much cheaper wireless rate (24 Euros for 24 hours). There's a convenient SHOPI supermarket across the road from which I replenished my water & snack supplies and sometimes grabbed a cheap dinner. You can utilize about 4 metro stations from the hotel, Saint Georges and Notre Dame De Lorette (Line 12) are the closest or Le Peletier and Cadet (Line 7) which are a bit further. Density of the metro lines means you'll probably only save a few minutes whichever station you choose and I ended up walking everywhere by day 9. Bottom line, this is not a luxury hotel but for price I never expected it to be and as long as I returned to a clean room and a hot shower I was satisfied. My only complaint arose from my final day when the elevator broke down and I had to DRAG my suitcase down 5 flights of stairs :(

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: sketchym8
Reviews.Content: For a good value hotel I would highly recommend and definately stay again at this hotel. We had two rooms in the hotel and stayed for one night. The rooms were small which is very much the norm in Paris at this pricerange. Rooms had all you could need. Bathroom was of a high standard and relatively spacious in the double room. Single room was smaller but sufficient. Both rooms has a/c which was needed as there was street noise with the windows open. Perfectly quiet when windows closed however. Staff were friendly and helpful. Very close to 'Notre Dame' metro, 1 min walk and 10mins to Guard De Nord main train station in taxi. 2 or 3 stops to Mont Matre station Allesses. Would recommend and stay again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, reasonably priced hotel, not for the claustrophobic though”
Reviews.Author: scotschris
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel France Albion for 5 nights in a room-only basis, so I can't speak for the continental breakfast, but we found the hotel to be clean and the linen/towels/toiletries etc all to be perfectly acceptable, especially considering the price we paid for the rooms. They also provided us with a travel cot for our infant child, but with this in the room in conjunction with our suitcases, navigating the room became a bit of an obstacle course. The rooms are very small, I'm not sure if all Parisian hotels suffer from this due to the nature of the overpopulated city, but it was very cramped indeed. Despite this, we had a very pleasant stay, no real issues with noise or anything - although be aware that when exiting the hotel and turning left, when you pass the St-Georges metro stop you're more or less in red-light territory. We passed through it once or twice without any incident, so don't be worried, but just in case that would influence your decision at all.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel but not mutch good if they give your room to someone else”
Reviews.Author: Taekwando1234
Reviews.Content: We arrived in france and found our hotel without too mutch difficulty .On arrival at reception were told that our room had been let to a group staying at the hotell that wanted to stay in the one hotell together. We told the receptionist that that wasn't good enough as we had recieved confirmation by email. We were told that there was a mix up with the bookings and she recomended us to take a room at the Modial Hotel a few doors away, the room was small and badly in need of modernisation and depressing to say the least, we were then moved to a larger room after our protests we stayed two days and then at last were roomed in the France Albion for the last two days of our stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel, GREAT service”
Reviews.Author: 1_Ms_T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the France Albion recently (June 2007) for 4 nights in a Superior Double Room (â‚¬ 115/night) and we loved it. The hotel and the room were very clean and the service was remarkable. We were very impressed with this nice 2-star, which is definitely a very superior 2-star. This hotel is not luxurious and the rooms are small like they would be in most European hotels, but they are not tiny. In any case, we were not looking for luxury. When we first walked into the room (Room 10), we thought about how small it was, but we got over that pretty quick. The room was clean and tidy. The room has a small tv and a safe (great plus!). Our room had one window overlooking what they call â€œthe courtyardâ€�. I wish Iâ€™d taken a picture so you could see, but the â€œviewâ€�, which wasnâ€™t much, is what I was told that makes this a Superior room. I guess it makes for a quieter room, but in any case, Notre Dame de Lorette seemed like very quiet street. If I stay there again, I think I would try out the regular room. The bathroom had the usual basic amenities (bathrobes were a nice touch), a window which makes it nice and bright, and a shower/tub. Even in 4-star hotels you may find a dirty or slightly moldy shower curtain, but I don't think you ever will in this hotel. There was hot water all the time and good water pressure. I know in France youâ€™d probably want to try a lot of different places to eat, but the hotelâ€™s American-style buffet was really nice. I would definitely recommend trying it (scrambled eggs, bacon, potatoes, delicious cheese, ham, yogurt, cereal). Once you sit down, they will bring you great coffee and wonderful bread and croissants. Now, our favorite part about this hotel was Kelly! Kelly works at the front-desk and was extremely nice and helpful. She made recommendations, gave us directions, marked our maps, and even made us reservations for a dinner cruise and a cabaret-show. She is definitely one of the reasons we liked this hotel so much and why weâ€™d recommend it so highly. Two more things... Use the metro... there is a couple of stations a block from the hotel and itâ€™s incredibly easy to get around (Once you can explain to the metro person the kind of tickets you want in English and a bit of sign language... Of course if you speak French you will do much much better than us, but we had Kelly write it down for us on the second day, because the first day we had no luck with a kinda-rude metro lady) All the stations have easy-to-understand maps and signs. Also, the cabs always take longer than they say they will when you call them and itâ€™s extremely hard to stop one on the street, so take that into account. It is a shame I canâ€™t remember the name, but there was a wonderful restaurant, about two blocks from the hotel with incredible food and great service. We had lunch there on our last day. As soon as I find the business card, I will edit this posting... but I did give a card to Kelly, so if you are heading there pretty soon, ask her (it is not the Fontaine Fiacre, she recommended it but we never tried it). Have fun in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Good price and location near Montmartre”
Reviews.Author: hhkexplorer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights last September. The hotel is small and located only a short walk from Montmarte and several Metro stations, making it a very easy base for sightseeing. We arrived about 9:30am so our room was not yet ready, but the woman at the reception desk were happy to provide us with a space to change and wash up. Throughout our stay, all of the staff were quite helpful in providing dining suggestions and directions. We stayed in a superior double room, which was small and basic, but nonetheless comfortable and clean. It seemed a very good deal for about 300 euros. The hotel offers a pay per use internet service in its bar and basic breakfast service. There are lots of small cafes close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Tripgirl24
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in a great location. It was very close to both the St. George and Notre Dame de Lorette stations. The neighborhood is great if you walk a little and there is a place very close by to do laundry. The room was good size with a bathroom & shower. The street is quiet and the hotel has internet access but you have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: travel_divaNYC
Reviews.Content: This quaint hotel provided a wonderful place to stay on my recent girls trip through Europe. The hotel is reasonably priced, the staff is wonderful and accomodating, the rooms are clean, decently sized and the bathrooms were great. (The water pressure is crazy!) I would definitely stay here again, as the location worked as a good base for sightseeing. You can walk to L'Opera, Galleries Lafayette, St. George and more. If you're interested, the sightseeing bus picks up at L'Opera as well. I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: coolcity
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel just up from Opera area ( 10 min walk ) nearest metro is St Georges about a 3 min walk. Area is a safe and middle class one and there are plenty of places to eat and good local food shops in the area, selling fresh bread, meat, fruit etc. The Hotel...Firstly don't let the 2 star rating put you off, the rooms are not huge but perfectly adequate, they are cleaned every day and well kept. The bed linen is changed daily and is exceptionally clean, better than many 4 star hotels i have stayed in..Nice plump pillow on a decent fairly firm bed ensures a good night's sleep. The bathrooms are modern, clean and functional and towels, face cloths are changed daily. The road that the hotel is situated on is fairly quiet for a central area of Paris. The staff are friendly and helpful and all speak English, but best of all is the manager who went out of her way to assist me with many of my tourist type questions and terrible directional sense. If you are looking for a reasonably priced centrally located hotel with no frills BUT with high standards of cleanliness, then i would highly recommend this hotel. 2 recommendations, firstly get a buzzer entry phone system fitted on the door at night rather than allow anyone to walk in, secondly make sure the luggage room is kept locked at all times if guests are leaving their luggage there on the last day before picking up Julian

Reviews.Title: “A most enjoyable stay !”
Reviews.Author: MrBergen
Reviews.Content: We came to Paris to get married and stayed for a week at this delightful hotel. This was our second stay at the Hotel France Albion. The staff were fantastic and helped us make arrangements for the wedding. When we arrived we were greeted warmly and we felt very welcome. On our wedding day we got a bottle of champagne as a gift from the hotel management â€“ a very nice surprise. The room was very nice and clean, and facing the quiet backyard. The hotel is perfectly situated in a central, but still quiet and safe area. The neighbourhood is typically Parisian with its intimate and relaxed atmosphere. There are a lot of cafes, restaurants, patisseries, shops etc in the area. We just love it here and will definitively stay here again the next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel France Albion - Excellent Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: debmac181
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned yesterday (23 April 2007) from our annual trip to Paris. We stayed at the Hotel France Albion for a second time. Again, we were not disappointed. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful and the room, albeit small, was spotlessly clean and pleasant. The day prior to our departure I required access to the internet to check in on line with Air France. The receptionist advised that the cost was 7 euro for 30 minutes or 10 euro for 1 hour. We explained we would only take approximately 5 or 10 minutes and were provided with free access. The weather during our visit was extremely hot for April. It reached 26 degrees each day which to us living in Manchester, England, was an absolute joy. The location of the hotel is superb and if you use a hotel as we do the France Albion is perfect. All we require is a place to store our belongings (each room contains a safe) and to shower and sleep. If you want luxury then you would need to pay substantially more as we did one year staying at the Hotel Jolly Lotti near to the Louvre, however, we still only used the hotel as a base and feel that the additional cost of a hotel is better used as spending money. I would also mention that we ate at the Ciel de Paris on the 56th floor of the Tour Montparnasse one evening. The views are breathtaking, the service was excellent and the food was pretty good (compared with Altitude 95). The meal for 2 cost 230 euro but that included a bottle of champagne and although some may consider this to be expensive it is still cheaper than a Bateaux tour along the Seine. I recommended the France Albion to another TA member "Kiwigirl" and would be very interested to know whether she actually stayed at the hotel and, if so, what her thoughts were.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: ladymacb29
Reviews.Content: I was worried about finding a good hotel when trying to schedule our honeymoon. I looked for two months and narrowed it down to a couple hotels, finally booking a week at the Hotel France Albion. We needn't have worried as our stay was comfortable and we'd definitely return and have recommended the hotel to anyone we hear of talking about planning a trip to Paris! My husband and I arrived early in the morning, before check-in, but this wasn't a problem as we were given a place to store our luggage while we explored the city before coming back later in the day when our room was ready. The staff all knew English and were all very kind/nice to deal with. Our room was bigger than I'd expected and faced the street. With the windows closed at night, there really wasn't any noise even when the garbage trucks went by. The bathroom was fairly large for what I expected, although I did have trouble figuring out exactly how to get the toilet to flush properly on the first try (I'd only once before had such trouble with a European toilet!). But my husband said he didn't have such problems... I must have had bad luck. ;) The bedroom and bathroom were cleaned every day and new toiletries and sheets were replaced each day. The only main downside is that the doors to the rooms are fairly thin and you can hear guests/maid staff out in the hallways in the morning. It isn't such a problem if you're an early riser, but for me who was tired of walking each morning (and, later on, had a cold so wanted to sleep in a little), the noise was a little annoying because I'm an extremely light sleeper. But the noise was only noticeable in the morning when they vaccuumed the carpeting, so nothing that should turn a potential guest away. I didn't notice any noise coming from the rooms next to me. The only way I knew the rooms were occupied was hearing them shut the doors in the morning. You do have to give them your room keys when you leave during the day - this way they know when you've left so you don't have to worry about them coming to clean your room while you're in the shower. Also, it's nice because you don't have to worry about losing your key while you're running around out in the city. The location is great. Frankly, I don't think being right next to the Eiffel Tower or another landmark would be the best - this hotel is literally a block away from two metro stations (Ntre Dme de Lorette and St Georges) so you can choose whether to approach the hotel from uphill or downhill (mind you, very slight hill). For when you first go to the hotel, I would really suggest the St Georges stop. Go toward the brasserie and then pass it so it's on your right and the hotel will be down the street on your right. My husband and I got a little turned around coming from the other metro station and when we found the St Georges one, we thought that would be the better one for first-time visitors to use - especially with heavy suitcases. The pictures of the rooms that are currently online are very accurate, although I didn't see the breakfast room... There's a good patisserie acorrs from the Notre Dame de Lorette metro station where you can get a croissant or something for breakfast. We did that or picked up something wherever our destination was instead of paying for the hotel's breakfast. One thing to consider is the time to get to the airport. We left the hotel around 9:30AM for our 1PM flight and arrived shortly before our flight boarded. This was due to problems finding the ticket booth in the train station for the RER train, the length of time getting to the place to check-in, only to find they changed the terminal and had to walk to the other end of the airport, the person checking passports taking 15 minutes per person, everyone getting a secondary screening when going back to the U.S. (despite no terror threat to the flight or in general), and construction at the airport to the Air France plane necessitating a 30 minute bus ride from the main terminal to the Air France area where the plane was... So plan to give yourself a lot of time when leaving the hotel if you're flying.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: stadhouderskade
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews on this website, we were convinced that this was the place to stay. The hotel met our expectations... We had booked a basic double room and upon arrival were issued a free upgrade to a superior double room. Our room was clean and made up every day. Althought it was small by North American standards, it was more than comfortable, and matched the pictures presented on the website. As well, the bathroom was surprisingly large, with a new soaking tub and a shower with amazing pressure. The hotel staff were all friendly, and all spoke English. There is an amazing organic bakery down the road, next to the church, which had unbelievable croissants... accordingly, we did not order the hotel breakfast, which relatively speaking was quite expensive at 12 euros. The hotel is walking distance to Gallery Lafayette, an amazing department store which cannot be missed, the Opera, and the Sacre Couer. All in all, a very pleasant stay at a hotel that we will surely consider again on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: imvidal24
Reviews.Content: I did my research with Trip Advisor before I booked and was not disappointed. To find great hotel in Europe is difficult, but the great reviews for the France Albion were right on the money. Our experience is Paris was amazing, and a great part of it was our stay at the France Albion. The manager and staff were extremely friendly. My husband and I were celebrating our 1 year wedding anniversary and they surprised us one evening with a small bottle of champagne. The hotel is centrally located, in between two metro stations (St. George and Notre Dame de Lorette). The rooms are small by American standards, but since 90% of the hotel rooms in Paris are the same it really did not matter. Another important point for me was the cleanliness. The bathroom was big and very clean as well. The airconditioning is a modern wall unit and worked very well, we had to turn it off because we were freezing at one point. Right in front of the hotel there is a small supermarket. Every morning we would buy prociutto, fruit, and yogurt. Then we went down the street and to the right, going towards the Notre Dame de Lorette Metro Station, right in front there is a bakery that sells amazing croissants and brioch. There is also a brasserie next to the hotel that sells delicious chicken. This saved us a lot of money, since the food is so expensive in Paris. All in all it was a perfect hotel and area for the price we paid. Unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “7 euros for half an hour internet!!!”
Reviews.Author: Davidfan
Reviews.Content: Ok stay in tiny room for 90 euros a night . Felt a bit overpriced. Clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: H-J-Bham
Reviews.Content: As one reviewer wrote, this is a 2* hotel but this certainly isnâ€™t a bad point. The hotel is in a quiet location and yes it is off a side street, but all the streets are side streets which adds to the charm of Paris as a whole. As for â€˜no frillsâ€™, well for a 2* hotel you donâ€™t expect too much but it had everything you needed - the room was clean, fresh and tidy. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was lovely with a really good hot shower and bath. As for â€˜no charmâ€™, again maybe they were expecting too much but the hotel building itself is a classic French building and we overlooked the street from the 5th floor so overlooked more classic amazing apartments. We didnâ€™t have breakfast there because it wasnâ€™t cheap, but mainly because there are too many patisseries and cafÃ©â€™s to go to instead. Because we spent so much time exploring Paris, we only really met the staff on reception, but they were very nice and helpful. The French really appreciate (and almost expect) you to speak their language, however, the hotel staff were more than happy to help us along with our appalling pronunciation and our shameful lack of knowledge of the French language!! More than anything, this hotel is in a perfect location; itâ€™s about a 10 minute walk to Sacre Coeur/Moulin Rouge area, 2 mins to St George metro station and no more than 5 minutes walk from Rue de Rivoli (excellent for cafÃ©â€™s, bistroâ€™s and restaurants) which is the start of all the main attractions. I would recommend this hotel if you want an excellent base for sightseeing in Paris, but if you want something more upmarket then this isnâ€™t the hotel for you. I give it 4 out of 5 and would go back. Also, you must go to Chez Flottes, on Rue Cambon, just off Rue de Rivoli â€“ excellent food/atmosphere/wineâ€¦the best French onion soup!!

Reviews.Title: “Most excellent”
Reviews.Author: andrewnealbrown
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel. We stayed here for four nights - total cost 420 euros for a "superior double room". The room was fabulous - even had towelling robes, an in-room safe, colour TV, lovely bathroom, views over...er...the back yard. Staff were fantastic - they spoke great English and tolerated my French. We didn't have breakfast as it seemed a bit steep and there are loads of cafes, patisseries, boulangeries etc around. Saint-Georges metro is 1 minute away and you can even walk from Gare du Nord or Gare St Lazare in 10-15 minutes. The area is lovely and seems pretty safe. Pigalle is up at the top of the road (10 minute walk) and many of the bars around have scantily clad ladies witing for customers but, as I was with my other half, I can't say we went in any of them. Loads of restaurants around and some fantastic shops. I recommend this hotel and this area very highly indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Good safe location”
Reviews.Author: Hoofits
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed for a whole week to celebrate his 40th Birthday and we booked this hotel based on the reviews on tripadvisor. The room was very clean and tidy, if a little small but also had an immaculate bathroom. Decor was fresh and clean and the photos of this hotel are very accurate. There are metro stations at the top and bottom ends of the street and I can highly recommend the excellent and friendly bakery mentioned in other reviews. We certainly tasted a lot of their fine baking during our stay! We found the reception staff very friendly and happy to talk to us in English even though we were trying to speak in French - perhaps this got us into their good books. While spending a very happy week in Paris we certainly felt we had booked the right hotel in the right location. About the only negative thing was the expensive breakfast but we thankfully didn't opt for it due to the fab bakery in the next street. We would definately go back here again as it was friendly, in a safe part of the city and a bargain at Â£66 per night for the room via expedia. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: RIstudent
Reviews.Content: After hours of searching tour books and websites, I finally picked this hotel because it was the highest rated by Tripadvisor for the price. The reviews were very accurate, and we had a perfect stay. We took an overnight flight from Boston, and our room was ready early so we did not have to wait. The shower was designed a little funky, but the whole bathroom was new and clean. The room was bigger and brighter than my best friendâ€™s, who was staying more in the city center. It was quiet and close to 2 different metro stops. We couldn't afford breakfast at the hotel; however there was an amazing bakery down the street and around the corner. There was a very convenient ATM located up the street. Our room was very clean, and we always felt safe in the neighborhood. I would defiantly stay here again, even if I wasn't a poor college student.

Reviews.Title: “You could do a lot better”
Reviews.Author: cosmoj
Reviews.Content: Small, budget hotel located on a Paris side-street. As another reviewer stressed, this is a 2 STAR HOTEL. No frills. No charm. Rooms are small and basic - look at the candid traveler photos to see. They were kept very clean, thankfully. Elevator is tiny and very slow. Front desk staff was usually incompetent or just plain rude. There are many more cuter, small hotels in Paris for the same price. Wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little place for the price”
Reviews.Author: BibbyB
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this little hotel based on others' reviews at this web site. It was small but very clean and cute. the neighborhood was good, safe enough. There were a number of good restaurants and convenient shops close by. Many different buses came nearby. It was very close to the Opera with the wonderful restaurants and stores of that area. Had a great time and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for budget-travellers”
Reviews.Author: magyar_lany
Reviews.Content: The hype about this hotel sounds a bit strange to me. It's not a 5 star hotel or anything similar. It's definitively a 2 star hotel and recommmendable for tourists, who spend a weekend in Paris and look for a simple cheap accomodation. We stayed 4 nights and enjoyed the nice neighbourhood (in rue de martyr is a very good bakery straight opposite to a 3-floor supermarket called "shopi") and the close access to the metro station "notre dame de lorette". due to the bakery and shopi the expensive hotel breakfast is not necessary. the street side is noisy, it's useful to keep the windows closed. bathroom is very small. the bed had a size of 140x200 cm and is small for 2 people. me and my boyfried are slim, so it was ok, but for stronger-built people it will be too small. the house is pretty old, the elevator rumbling, but room and bath clean and staff friendly. on the first morning the water heater in the cellar was out of order, all guests had to take a cold shower. but is was mended by the evening. generally spoken, i recommend it but always with the information, that it is a simple 2 star hotel. we would stay there again, if we get the next time the same cheap rate via expedia (germany) as we got now.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, not great”
Reviews.Author: bikes&boats
Reviews.Content: $148/night after taxes. This was the standard "all rooms are small in Paris" room with one full sized bed. It was called a "Superior room-Superior double" by the hotel. It had a decent bathroom. A back alley view. The tub was high I remember so it was a long step down when getting out on a potentially slippery floor. The location is okay. We really preferred it when we stayed in the Latin Quarter. This hotel is near some Metro stops that will take you anywhere you need to go. I did not order the hotel's breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel - will stay again”
Reviews.Author: visited-in-June
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because we were on a budget and from the reviews on tripadvisor it sounded like great value for money and we weren't disappointed. Rooms are basic and simply decorated but are comfortable, have air conditioning and are kept very clean. The road noise at the front can be loud but with the windows shut it isn't a problem. Staff were friendly and helpful - spoke good English and enjoyed our attempts at French. Many tourist sites are within easy walking distance (e.g Louvre about 20 mins) and there are a couple of metro stops nearby. Breakfast is expensive but there's a good patisserie round the corner and there are also good quality and reasonably priced restaurants (around 60 euros for 3 courses and wine for 2) just up the hill from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mavrede
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in Jul. It was a wonderful experience. We arrived and were greeted in perfect English by a pleasant girl working. She showed us to our room and offered to help with our luggage. The room was small (but this is expected in Paris) but had a good size bathroom and was very clean! It had excellent air-conditioning which was tremendous because it had been close to 100 F for a week. There was little street noise with the windows closed. The mattress was firm but comfortable. The price of the hotel was extremely good considering the time of year we stayed. It is a block walk to the St. Georges Metro station with easy access to the downtown. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a clean, affordable place to stay close to the downtown of Paris..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and a Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: prere
Reviews.Content: I booked into the albion because of the decent reviews and great price on expedia ($77/night) for a single. The room was very nice (typical small size), the bathroom was spacious, and the air conditioning, nice elevator and nice overall appearance were much more than I had expected at the price. Service was great with a nice staff and the manager even let me use the conference room to work one day. The single room is too small to do real work if you're in paris on business. If you use Internet, I'd recommend skipping the overpriced Albion service. There appeared to be several available wifi hotspots if you want to take the risk. There is a nice square up the hill if you make a right at the first stop light. I spent a few days on the benches or in the cafes there using a good free Internet connection. Coin laundry is up the hill as well and there is a very good supermarket right across the street from the hotel. For comparison, I moved from the Hotel St. Louis and was very pleased. The Albion really should be a 2.5 or 3 star rather than a 2 star. Great stay - especially if you can get a deal with expedia!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had an Excellent Stay at the Hotel France Albion”
Reviews.Author: AJSRAS
Reviews.Content: Our family of four recently stayed at the Hotel France Albion and found it to be a very clean, well-kept hotel with very capable, friendly staff. It is located in a relatively quiet neighborhood, with a nice selection of cafes and specialty markets nearby. Access to the Metro is close and convenient. The rooms were very clean and nicely furnished, with good natural lighting and ventilation (although the air conditioning was also nice to have when needed). The room prices were very reasonable -- good value for the money, although we didn't try the breakfast buffet at the hotel, which seemed a bit pricey. Definitely had a good overall experience and would recommend it to others!

Reviews.Title: “Stop Over at Paris”
Reviews.Author: akagulliver
Reviews.Content: We just completed our travel across Switzerland with a brief stop over at Paris for 3 days as the last leg of the journey. The total trip being for more than 2 weeks. Whilst all the Swizerland hotels were three stars - with a fair bit of trepidation based on some web surfing (Trip advisor) I had booked the Albion hotel which was 2 star. This was despite advise from others that star ratings for Paris hotels were quite misleading and more often than not the hotels did not live upto the star ratings. However our experience at Albion was excellent leaving us extremely gratified at our choice. Its a budget hotel with an overall ambience far greater than hotels of a higher category in the city. Its clean, well maintained, pleasant and with a daily supply of towels and toiletry (unlike other European budget hotels which have a dual bath ----- shampoo holder fixed to the wall). It has very friendly and helpful staff who are conversant in English. Its placed in a quite and safe neighbourhood even though its within walking distance of Pigalle. The metro is very convenient - two stations within a 3 minute walk - though as a tourist we preferred over ground transport. Do agree with other reviewers that the breakfast was overpriced given the choices available outside. Though the room was not big but was not too small either. A big unexpected plus was the split airconditioner in the room which was indeed a necessity (a criteria overlooked by us when we did the bookings for the other hotels in Switzerland) given the 30+Degree centigrade temperatures in Europe this summer. Overall a very pleasant experience and between my wife and I we have agreed that for our next visit to the city we will be choosing this hotel once again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It is a little removed from downtown but a great little place with clean rooms, a subway at the end of the street, sights within walking distance and a nice comfortable bed. You need to go up Rue des Martyrs and look for a small pastry store on the right with an entrance diagonal to the street. The best mini-quiches (hockey puck size) you will ever eat. My wife and I actually took them with us each day for lunch and snacks. I think we had 10 each in 3 days. Look for the tomatoe and anchovie one. I would stay here again as I have no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Par Excellence”
Reviews.Author: rastawoman123
Reviews.Content: Thanks to tripadvisor we found this wonderful, inexpensive, thoroughly charming hotel. Everything was just as pictured here. From the moment of our somewhat late arrival where we were warmly greated and assisted by Dominick, to the lovely morning desk lady who gave us excellent directions to the Eiffel tower, to the very sweet afternoon young lady that helped us get ice for my husband's sore knee, and the also lovely young lady who assisted us on our last evening getting information on the concert venue we were to visit, the service was impeccable.
