These are the friendliest people in Paris. I am so sorry to have not gotten all their names. The whole trip was sensory overload. The neighborhood is delightful. Dominick directed us to a newer restaurant in the area, Fuxia, which had great food, wine and atmosphere. As total strangers in town we actually struck up conversations with other patrons and had a great time. The hotel is close to the Montmarte area which is well worth a visit. Took the Funicular to Sacre Coeur. Most sights were walking distance if you had the time and you had the opportunity to see the city along the way. We took public buses all over instead of organized tours. We bought the Carte Orange for each of us the first day, a Monday. What a great deal. You just show your card on the buses and can get on and off at any stop. A small ticket is attached which you use in the metro ticket machine. The metro stations are very convenient but the hotel's location halfway between the two kept this busy little side street fairly quiet in this hustle bustle city. We had no problem with the street noise and kept our windows slightly ajar most days and nights. Never had a moment's fear for our safety. The accomodations are immaculate and plenty roomy. Beds are very comfortable and we both slept well. The bath area was enormous for a small European hotel. The breakfast we had one day was plentiful and very convenient for our schedule. There was enough food to make two small sandwiches which we took with us for our jaunt to Luxembourg Gardens. The cellar room is a bit warm. The only other negative was the small TV which did not get many channels. We were not there to watch TV anyway, but the French Open was in progress and my husband is a sports nut. He did watch it while he nursed his knee. All in all, I would not stay anyplace else in Paris. It was all we needed. Don't look any further. This place is more than worth the money. Three stars plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Clean, good service and great location. Walking distance to train, Montmatre, Opera (La Fayette and Printemps for shopping) Didn't eat breakfast at the hotel so i can't comment it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and easy”
Reviews.Author: rh74
Reviews.Content: Stayed here very last minute on a Saturday night in Paris when original reservation at a nearby hotel turned out to be non-existent! Front desk staff were friendly and helpful. Room was very clean, decor modern but quite plain. Reasonable room size for a Paris hotel - bigger than the one our friends had at the nearby, trendier-looking BW Lorette Opera. Air conditioning worked perfectly. Bathroom very clean with tub and shower. Bed a bit hard but comfortable enough. Wardrobe had safe and hairdryer. Our room was on the fifth floor so i don't know if lower rooms would be noisier, although the street isn't busy at all, and all rooms have double glazing. Location is good - lowkey, residential, but quite central, about 100 metres to either Notre Dame de Lorette or St Georges Metro stations, with a couple of good corner shops for snacks and provisions 20 metres away. Just up the road past St Georges Metro station there is a little square with some nice cafes and restaurants. This is a decent 2 star hotel and I'd definitely recommend it if you want somewhere clean, quiet, friendly and fuss-free to put your head down for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean, the bathrooms big with nice showers and tubs for those evening soaks after walking around Paris. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the location is excellent. 2 close Metro stops, Monmartre, Pigalle, Paris Opera within walking distance. Lovely restuarants and bakery shops nearby. The rooms are small but nice.

Reviews.Title: “dont believe the hype”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one week at the hotel, didnt like it on bit. You can not sleep at night from all the noise.. We asked the to fix our safe, they kept promising us , but didnt. Our t.v set didnt have any channels didnt fix that either. The breakfast is expensive for what you get. The rooms are not that clean. Went to this hotel due to te reviews big mistake. Loved paris Most beautiful city in the world. Will return to the city not to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jmstravel
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms, friendly staff. Our room was over the street and so noisy with windows open. But the windows closed did an excellent job of damping the noise for sleeping. They sell you internet time which is rather expensive, they could do that more cheaply. We liked the neighborhood location. The Metro station is very close (Use the Saint Georges station).

Reviews.Title: “clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: gill h
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend in Paris. The France Albion is kept extremely clean but is very basic. Young female staff very pleasant and helpful. Bar next door friendly and a great place to sit late at night watching the parisians walk by. Good value leabanese food straight opposite the hotel espeacially the vegetarian options. Hotel incredibly cheap. Witnessed a pickpocketing on the metro - they identified travellers with lots of baggage and pretended to help them on the train. Be aware!

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what is required”
Reviews.Author: LeithySuburbs
Reviews.Content: Just a short review to echo the previous sentiments regarding this hotel. Good safe location; good room rate; very clean; helpful english speaking staff; good Metro access. We never ate breakfast in the hotel - 12E each seemed a bit steep - but there are many cafes and boulangeries/patisseries close by to offer great food at a fraction of the cost. You may have to go a bit further afield for dinner as there are not that many quality restaurants nearby - it is a mainly residential area. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: nickfromflorida
Reviews.Content: we stayed here april 13-17 and found it to be very nice - rooms are small but ok for two - we had a deluxe - room #50 with a larger than expected bathroom - extremely clean with tiles and a tub with shower and radiator and windows that opened - the fan/ac only provided a fan at this point so no ac was on, but we opened the windows to make it cooler sometimes - we looked out on the back alley, but just over the rooftop and the chimneys, you could see the very top of the eiffel tour! (was not advertised as room with view of tower, thankfully, though!) the breakfast is steep at 12 euro per person but is very good and we ate there every morning primarily out of convenience - they bring you choice of tea or coffee and they supply milk and oj, eggs to boil or poach in a metal box/machine - a variety of pastries and some excellent apricot and rasberry preserves (in big jars near buffet) also served scrambled eggs, sliced potatos and bacon each morning and had yogurt and cereal also - the people at the desk were friendly and spoke english - the manager was a little brusque when we asked if we could leave post cards at the desk for mailing - she pointed to a mailbox outside as if we were idiots - sorry, but in U.S. it is no big deal to leave them at the desk and we did not notice the box outside - instead of being rude she could have told us to make sure we mailed them in the etranger slot for overseas, but luckily I knew that. - bill was correct and the stay was nice - rooms lock well - you can hear others coming and going but no big deal - elevator is bigger than another reviewer stated - will hold 4 people or at least two or three and some luggage

Reviews.Title: “Great European Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hoss27
Reviews.Content: Overall, my wife and I had a great stay at this hotel. Paris was wonderful in mid-March and this hotel made it even more so. The price was right, and the hotel was recently remodeled, clean, and up-to-date. The staff was fantastic. All spoke very good English and all were incredibly friendly, at all times of day as we came and went. Speaking from experience, you will not find a better hotel than this in Europe unless you are willing to spend an arm and a leg. The hotel is out of the major tourist districts (great if you want to experience the real Paris), but the location is so convenient. Two Metro stations are within a block or two away, making every major destination in Paris less than about a five minute train ride away. A short walk away from the hotel are some really nice little bakeries and cafes. Grab a couple bakery items at one of the corner bakeries and have a seat at the counter of the Cafe Bleu for a morning cafe au lait. When you first arrive, the Hotel France Albion can be a bit tricky to find. After a long flight from Chicago, it took my wife about an hour looking at maps and dragging our bags around on the Paris streets until we finally located the place. Here's a tip: take the Metro to the station Notre Dame de Lorette, and the hotel is immediately up the street and around the corner. Just search for the station on any of the maps in the metro stations. If you are looking for a great meal on the go at an inexpensive price, try a restaurant called Brioche Doree. Its a local chain, so you'll see them here and there throughout the city. For a real Parisian experience, find the street called Rue Cler and hang out a bit at the cafes and shops. Its not far from the Place des Invalides.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Clean Two Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ElizHan
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on reviews on Trip Advisor and was not disapointed. I booked a double room and was placed on the 5th Floor. The room was small and clean with a good bathroom. The hotel was very quiet and the staff were friendly. Although there are two Metro stops less than 5 minutes walk away we chose to walk to most places we visited. Check out close by Rue des Martyrs for excellent foodie shops and restaurants. We recommend the anglo-french 'Rose Bakery' for to-die-for savoury tarts, salad and crumble! We also loved La Fourmi CafÃ© for Italian food. I would definitely choose to stay at Hotel France Albion again when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A nice two-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: spailey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing its many fabulous reviews on this Web site. I wasnâ€™t sure what to expect from a two-star hotel, and was relatively pleasantly surprised. However, make no mistake: this is definitely a two-star hotel, although some of the reviews here may lead you to believe otherwise. The hotel, and the room itself, were small, but the staff was friendly (and English-speaking), and we were upgraded to a deluxe room on the second floor at no extra charge. Unhappy that this was a smoking room after asking for non-smoking, but for the extra space it was probably worth it, and the two windows opened very wide, so it was usually a non-issue. The room was very basic, no luxuries, but it was clean, and thatâ€™s the most important thing. We had a double bed, small closet, and a desk in our room. There was enough space to store our large pieces of luggage without tripping over them. I couldnâ€™t figure out how to use the thermostat, and the room was very warm, which may be a problem in the summer (not in March, though!). The bathroom was very nice and clean, although there was no shower curtain in the tub. I never figured out how not to drench the entire bathroom during my shower. The neighborhood was okay, nothing to brag about, but nothing wrong with it, either. Two Metro stations are insanely close; we took it everywhere. We didnâ€™t do nearly enough exploring until our last day, when we found some really cute shops and restaurants within blocks. Our room was facing the (busy) street, and since we slept with the windows wide open, there was a lot of noise. Particularlyâ€”there seemed to be a motorcycle club just up the street. The motorcycles never stopped! We adjusted pretty quickly, but others may not be so lucky. Never once did we hear the guests next door, although I know people were staying there. Used wireless Internet in the room--it cost a fortune (7E for 30 minutes, 12 for an hour, 24 for a full day), but I can't be without it. The staff wasn't terribly helpful when it came to dining recommendations, so we found everything ourselves. We did a lot of walking--to the Louvre, d'Orsay, etc. It can be done, but they're all long walks. Take the Metro instead.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just been to a short trip to Paris, for shopping and just to relax. We stayed at the France Albion, which was just a great hotel. - 2 stars upgraded. The service at the hotel was excellent, cosy and really personal, fab breakfast and at really affordable prices. The rooms were a good size for the price, which is not often the case in 2 star hotels. The hotel is located really centrally, close to the opera, mont-matre, cosy atmosphere in the streets, and good restaurants. All in all, I can only say that I had a really great experience at the hotel and it made my stay in lovely Paris even more enjoyable.
